Some of the types of wood she buys to sell are: shihuahuaco, quinilla, quillobordon, capirona, etc. She gets up about 5 in the morning to go to the Port of Manatay, where all the wood sellers get together, and she buys the type of wood she likes to later cut it in planks and then sell it.

With this loan, wich she will repay within 5 months, she will buy different types of wood, pay for the cutting services and pay for the transportation, etc.

Keyla feels good because she doesn't depend on anybody and thanks to Manuela Ramos she was able to start her own business which is very streneous but she loves it anyways!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Keila pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el AA. HH. Nuevo Edén Mz. D Lt. 1, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la compra y venta de madera en tablones. En la actualidad cuenta con tablones de diversas especies forestales para la venta. Entre las especies que compra para luego venderlas son: shihuahuaco, quinilla, quillobordon, capirona, etc. Normalmente se levanta a las 5.00 a.m. para ir al puerto de manantay a buscar vendedores de madera de las especies con las que trabaja para luego mandarlas cortar en tablones y así poder venderlas. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de madera de diversas especies, en el pago por el servicio de corte para transformar su materia prima en tablones, en el pagó por el transporte de la madera, etc. Keyla se siente muy bien porque no depende económicamente de nadie y gracias a Manuela Ramos pudo emprender su propio negocio, el cual reconoce que es muy pesado pero que no deja de esmerarse a diario y con ello la hace sentir muy contenta.

loans.use: To purchase different types of wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Señora Lidia is a member of the communal bank called 'Women with a Future', which is located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 54 years old and a mother of 6 adult children. She's married and her husband is a salesman. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a snack/sandwich shop

She owns a kiosk where she sells fruit juices and breakfast. She gets up about 5:00 am to open up her kiosk with the help of her husband and her daughter who both help her until 11:00 am.

With the loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase all sorts of clothes since she also runs a clothing business located by the river.

Lidia is doing fine since she depends on the profits from her businesses to move ahead because she believes that if you don't invest your money then you don't make any. She's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for her support.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lidia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en Jr Salvador Allende 759, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años, es madre de 6 hijos, todos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es comerciante, Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. En la actualidad cuenta con un Kiosco donde vende jugos y desayunos. Se levanta a las 5 a.m. para abrir su negocio que atiende con la ayuda de su esposo y su hija hasta las 11 a.m. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará todo lo que concierne al negocio de ropa ya que cuenta además con un negocio que esta ubicado por el río. Lidia está muy bien porque ella piensa que depende de la inversión y de las ganas de salir adelante para ver el progreso, porque el que no invierte no produce y además está muy agradecida al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more merchandise for her store and also in books

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Señora Norma is a member of the communal bank called 'Nuevo Eden' which is located in the district of Yarina Cocha in Ucayali. She's 28 years old. She has 4 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a painter. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small grocery store.

She runs her grocery store from her home. She gets up each morning about 6:00 am to prepare breakfast for her family while she runs her store at the same time.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

Norma feels that her finances are very good since she's able to manage her own business and she's able to help with the schooling for her children. She's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all her support.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en Pasaje Francisco del Águila Mz D Lt 3, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años, es madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es pintor. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en su hogar. A diario se levanta a las 6 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y simultáneamente atiende en la bodega .. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 4 cajas de huevos, 1 caja de leche, etc. Norma se siente estable económicamente porque puede manejar su propio negocio y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y está muy agradecida al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase basic food supplies such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Felipa's Group

texts.en:
Esabel, Felipa, and Zenobia have been part of the community bank “Kusikuy”, which means "be happy" in Quechua, for one, two, and two respectively.

Isabel is 24 years old, she is married and has one child. Isabel knits sweaters, which she sells at different markets. She also sells roasted corn from a cart in the center of the city.

Felipa is 40 years old. She also knits sweaters that she sells at different markets. In addition, she sells vegetables at markets around Ayacucho and buys cheese, which she sells in the city.

Zenobia is 42 years old. She is married and has six children. Zenobia travels to different markets selling food staples, and fruits. From the markets she buys grains, cheese, and animals that she sells in the city.

Esabel, Felipa and Zenobia need loans of 800, 800, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying corn, wool, chickens, sheep, cheese, onion, celery, rice, sugar, and fruits.

In the community bank they have learned to be punctual, and how to invest in their business. In addition, they have learned about self-esteem and how to have a positive relationship with their husbands. Esabel, Felipa and Zenobia dream of being able to open a store in their homes, that their children will be professionals, and to own their homes.

loans.use: Esabel, Felipa and Zenobia need loans of 800, 800, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying corn, wool, chickens, sheep, cheese, onion, celery, rice, sugar, and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Purchase additional merchandise and a copy machine

Comprar mas mercaderia y una copiadora

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es:
Señora Nuria is a member of the community bank called 'Cesar Vallejo', which is located in Calleria, Ucayali. She's 37 years old and has 3 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a teacher. With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to purchase a motor-tricycle taxi.

She has hired someone to drive the motor-tricycle taxi. She gets up about 6:00 am to prepare breakfast for her family, and then she gets the motor-tricycle ready for the driver. She splits the money she makes with her driver.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will pay to renew her 'tags', pay for insurance, pay for her driver's permit, etc.

Nuria tells us that she has always found ways to move ahead in life even against all odds. She's very proud of herself and of her accomplishments. She's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for her support.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nuria pertenece al banco comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en Jr. Padre Abad 199, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos, todos aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es profesor. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300, que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la compra de un motocarro. En la actualidad cuenta con un motocarro, el cual lo maneja un chofer. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de su esposo y el de sus hijos y luego le entrega al chofer el motocarro para que salga a trabajar y así le pueda entregar la cuota diaria que le corresponde. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en el pago del derecho de placa de su motocarro, en la compra del SOAT para su motocarro, en la tarjeta de conducir, etc. Nuria manifiesta que siempre supo salir adelante entre viento y marea y está orgullosa de si misma y de ver que todo le esta yendo bien. También está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos el gran apoyo que le brinda.

loans.use: To renew her tags, pay for insurance and for a driver's permit

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Señora Sonia belongs to the community bank called 'Banco Comunal Cesar Vallejo' which is located in Calleria, Ucayali. She is 46 years old. She has 2 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a salesman. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small business of selling and buying metals.

She currently runs her business of selling and buying all types of metals. She also raises chickens and she also rents rooms. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to feed her chickens, she then prepares breakfast for her family and lastly she attends to her business of selling and buying metals which she runs from home.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she would like to purchase metals such as copper, bronze and aluminium. She will also fix up the rooms that she rents, and she will purchase more food for her chickens.

Sonia thinks of herself as an entrepreneur because she started all of these businesses and she administrates them on her own. This is why she's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she's giving her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en Jr Maya D. Brito 673, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años, es madre D. 2 hijos que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 que recibió D. Manuela Ramos deciD. invertir en un negocio D. compra y venta D. metales. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio D. compra y venta D. todo tipo D. metales, además posee un galpón D. pollos y con un negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones. Se levanta a las 5 D. la mañana para colocarles agua y comida a sus pollos, luego prepara el desayuno D. su esposo y el D. sus hijos y por último se dedica a atender su negocio D. compra y venta D. metales en su casa. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. metales tales como cobre, bronce, aluminio; también invertirá en la refacción D. las habitaciones que alquila y en la compra D. comida para sus pollos. Sonia se considera una mujer emprendedora porque posee varios negocios que ella misma los administra, es por ello que está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase metals such as copper, bronze, aluminium and to fix up her rentals

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Señora Teresa is a member of the community bank called 'Women with a Future', which is located in the district of Calleria in the state of Ucayali. She is 33 years old and a mother of 3 young children. She's married and her husband is a fisherman. With the first loan that she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she bought some snacks/candy for her store.

At this time, she takes care of her small store and she's also a dressmaker. She gets up very early each morning about 6 am to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband. She simultaneously takes care of her store and the dressmaking as well.

With this loan which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, body soaps, laundry detergent, etc.

Teresa is doing very well. Her store is getting bigger and so is her clientele. She's also very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all her support.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en AA. HH. 2 de Mayo Mz H Lt. 17, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, es madre de 3 hijos, todos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es pescador. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en golosinas. En la actualidad se dedica a la atención de su bodega y a la confección de ropa. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y esposo y simultáneamente atiende la bodega y confecciona sus prendas de sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de huevos, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de jabones, 1 bolsa de detergente, etc. A Teresa le va muy bien, su bodega está creciendo en productos y en clientes, también está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que brinda.

loans.use: To purchase basic food supplies such as rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Orfelinda's Group

texts.en:
Edith, Orfelinda and Juana are members of the community bank “Cusi Urpi”. They have been members for two, three, and five years respectively. In that time they have learned the importance of punctuality, responsibility, and honesty.

Edith is 33 years old and has one 7-year-old child. For several years Edith has been selling shoes but with her new loan she will begin to sell breads and pastries. She is excited about this because people rarely buy shoes and selling bread, which people buy daily, will give her a more even and dependable source of income.

Orfelinda is 33. She has two children and is expecting her third. Orfelinda was encouraged to join the community bank by her cousin and has five other family members who are associates. She has been selling food staples such as flour and sugar from her home for ten years. She is also an artisan and makes intricate wooden altarpieces, a skill she learned from her parents.

Juana is 68 years old and has two adult children. She has a small store where she sells food staples. She has been selling groceries since she was very young.

Edith, Orfelinda, and Juana need loans of 600, 400, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in bread products, flour, butter, grocery items such as, rice, beans, and oil, and artisan products such as wood and paint.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest earning account. Edith, Orfelinda and Juana plan to use their savings to pay their children’s school fees and health care. Orafalinda was saving to buy a house until her mother got sick and Juana is trying to help her grand children, whose mother abandoned them. Their dreams are that their children and grandchildren have a better life.

loans.use: Edith, Orfelinda, and Juana need loans of 600, 400, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in bread products, flour, butter, grocery items such as, rice, beans, and oil, and artisan products such as wood and paint.

loans.name: Paulina Marina's Group

texts.en:
Augustina and Marina have been members of the community bank “Kusikuy” for 13 years. Martina has been a member for 8. In that time they have learned about responsibility, punctuality, and a good work ethic. In addition they have learned about self-esteem, educating their children, and getting along with their neighbors. Within their bank they feel united and able to support each other, this is what they say is lacking in other banks.

Augustina is 38. She is single and doesn’t have children of her own, but has been raising her nieces and nephews. She sells emoliente, which is a traditional beverage made from herbs and served warm. She has been doing this for 22 years.

Martina is 39 and has three children. She has been selling grains for the past six years from a stand in the central market of Ayacucho. She sells a variety of grains such as wheat, barley, quinoa, and oats.

Marina is 62 years old and has two adult children. She has been selling food staples such as flour and beans for 10 years. Before that she traveled to the country to buy leather and sell it in Ayacucho, but enjoys having to travel less.

Augustina, Marina, and Martina need loans of 800, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their business by buying things such as sugar, wheat, cornmeal, barley, flour, milk, and oil. They dream of owning their homes and giving their children an education.

loans.use: Augustina, Marina, and Martina need loans of 800, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their business by buying things such as sugar, wheat, cornmeal, barley, flour, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia lives in the community of San Rafael. She has been part of the community bank “Allim Llamqaqkuna”, which means "work well" in Quechua, for one year. In the community bank she has learned how to educate their children, how to handle money, and how to invest.

Bonifacia is 51 years old. She has eight children and is illiterate. Bonifacia sells fruits from a cart in Ayacucho. She also raises cattle with her husband. Bonifacia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in pineapples, apples, oranges, and bananas. She will also buy a cow for milk, and a bull to later butcher.

An important part of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Bonifacia plans to use her savings to buy cattle, pay for her children’s schooling, build a home, and if there is an emergency. She dreams of having a nice house, that her children will be professionals, and that her businesses will continue to grow.

loans.use: Bonifacia, needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in pineapples, apples, oranges, and bananas. She will also buy a cow for milk, and a bull to later butcher.

loans.name: Teodosia's Group

texts.en:
Teodosia, Sabina, and Angelica have been part the community bank “Señor de Luren” for between one and three years. In their bank they have learned valuable business skills such saving and responsibility. In addition, they have learned skills such as nutrition, how to educate their children, and how to have a positive relationship with their husbands.

Teodosia is 51 years old. She is a widow and has seven children. Teodosia travels to different markets selling fruit. In the market she buys grains, potatoes, cheese, and other products, which she re-sells in Ayacucho. Teodosia also makes and sells “moliente”, which is a traditional beverage made from local herbs and served warm.

Sabina is 41, she is separated from her husband and has six children. She sells live chickens and fruit in various markets around Ayacucho. There she buys potatoes, and other grains, which she sells in the city. She also sells shish kabob from a cart in the market.

Angelica is 30 years old. She is married and has four children. Angelica makes typical breads such as “chapla”, a type of bread similar to pita. She makes her bread in a rented oven. Angelica also travels to Lima where she sells purses in the Miraflores market.

Teodosia, Sabina, and Angelica need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying cheese, chickens, barley, quinoa, sugar, and flour. The community bank emphasizes the importance of savings and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Teodosia, Sabina, and Angelica plan to use their savings to buy a piece of land, and to pay for medical treatment. Their dreams are to own land, that their children will be professional, and that they will have good health.

loans.use: Teodosia, Sabina, and Angelica need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying cheese, chickens, barley, quinoa, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.en:
Luzmila has been a part of the community bank “Señor D. Luren” for 10 years. She is 62 years old, widowed and has eight children, six of whom are still living with her. In the community bank Luzmila has learned to be responsible, punctual, how to invest her money, how to save, as well as to be more understanding.

Luzmila sells a typical ice cream from the region called “Muyuchi” which is maD. from fresh mild, coconut, cinnamon, and sugar. She needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying sugar, milk, coconut, and salt.

Each member of the community bank has an interest earning savings account. Luzmila plans to use hers to pay for the things that her children need. Her dream is that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: Luzmila needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying sugar, milk, coconut, and salt.

loans.name: Alfoncia's Group

texts.en:
Raida, Irene and Alfoncia have been part of the community bank “Señor de Luren” for the past 6, 4, and 2 years respectively. In their bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, how to invest their money, how to avoid domestic violence, and to share.

Raida is a single mother; she has three children and is 37 years old. Raida has owned a restaurant on the central street of Ayacucho for the past year. She specializes in “chicharrones” or fried pork. Previously, Raida sold ceviche, a traditional dish made from marinating fish in lemon juice and herbs, near the prison. She decided to open the restaurant because the work is steadier.

Alfoncia is 66 years old. She is divorced and has five children. Alfoncia sells cheese in the Nery G. market of Ayacucho. She also sells products that she buys from markets in the countryside such as fruits and vegetables.

Irene is 57 years old, widowed and has two children. Irene sells “picarones”, which are sweets made from flour, squash, sweet potato, and egg from a cart.

These women need loans of 600, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, rice, sugar, pork, beans, oil, flour, fruits, and vegetables.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has her own interest earning savings account. Raida, Irene, and Alfoncia plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s education, health care, and in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to own a home, have everything that is necessary, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: These women need loans of 600, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, rice, sugar, pork, beans, oil, flour, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en:
Khafiz S. is 47 years old and married with 5 children. Two of the older children are already married and the other three are still living with their parents.

Khafiz is the only one person supporting this large family as his wife is the housekeeper. He runs a small private café where he cooks and sells kebabs. Khafiz started out fifteen years ago as a kitchen assistant cooking kebabs. Gradually he became so experienced that he decided to open his own small café which has been in business for 10 years already.

Khafiz is planning to expand his café. Thus, he shall need to increase his inventory, by purchasing more plates, dishes and plastic tables and chairs to accommodate his growing number of clients. For all this, Khafiz requests 1800.00 Somoni (US$525) for a term of 12 months. This is Khafiz's first loan. However, since he has a stable business, he would like to assure all that he will be able to pay in time, and to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: Expanding of business and purchasing of inventory like plates, dishes, plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
A. Rustam is turning 21 this week -- but in spite of his young age, he is already the father of a charming daughter, aged one. 

Rustam used to help his mother isell fish when he was 13 years old. Today he runs his own business and his mother now helps him. Rustam sells fish in the central local market. Rustam’s business is the only source of income for his family as his wife keeps house and looks after their daughter. His business is quite stable with a turnover capital of US$ 2,000. 

Today Rustam requests US$500 for a term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase fish wholesale. This is Rustam's second loan with IMON. He has a good loan repayment record, as his previous loan was paid accurately and in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing fish wholesale

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda has been selling fabrics for the past 18 years. She has a space on the Korvon market. She has a large assortment of fabrics and she also sells traditional national pants from the local sewing manufacturers. Mavluda buys her inventory in bulk rolls and has a very quick return. The fabrics are imported from Dubai and Siria.

Mavluda has 6 children and plans to open a sewing shop to make national clothes and employ her children in the future. She wants to use the loan from Kiva to buy high quality fabrics with insulation from the inside which have a very high demand on the market. On the photo, Malvuda is serving a customer and cutting the fabric.

Translated from Russia by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Мавлюда занимается продажей тканей уже18 лет.Её торговая точка расположена на рынке Корвон.Она имеет широкий ассортимент тканей, а так же она продает национальные изоры(штаны)местных швейных цехов.Закупает она товар рулонами и имеет достаточно быстрый оборот.Ткани ей поставляют из Дубая и Сирии.

У неё 6 детей и в будущем она хочет открыть цех по пошивы национальной одежды и обеспечить своих детей работой. На займ с КИВЫ она хочет закупить тканей высокого качества и утепленные с изнаночной стороны , которые пользуется высоким спросом на рынке.( на фото она обслуживает клиента и разрезает ткань)

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira K. is 42 years old. She is married to a teacher and has two children. Their elder daughter is 18 and the younger son is 15 years old.

Mohira sells clothes in a store located in the one of the local markets. She has already been in this business for 2 years. Mohira started by selling childrens' clothing. However, with time she came to conclusion that it was more profitable for her to sell womens' clothing instead. As teachers are not paid very well at the present time, Mohira’s business is the main source of income for her family.

Today, Mohira requests US$600 to purchase womens winter clothes for sale. This is the second time Mohira will be receiving a loan from IMON. Mohira managed to pay the previous loan precisely and timely. The term of the loan is 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase women's winter clothes

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đào Thị Huyền, 30 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund, Kim Động branch. Her husband is a farmer. They have a 5 years old child. Mrs. Huyền is a hair stylist, has been for 2 years. She has a lot of customers due to her workmanship and social skill. Her average income is 125USD a month. She is applying for a loan of 625USD to purchase more tools and expand her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đào Thị Huyền, 30 tuổi, là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh Kim Động. Chồng chị là một nông dân, hai anh chị mới có một con 5 tuổi. Nghề nghiệp chính của chị Huyền là gội đầu, chăm sóc sắc đẹp cho chị em phụ nữ. Chị làm nghề này đã được 2 năm. Có kỹ thuật tốt lại khéo chiều khách nên cửa hàng của chị lúc nào cũng đông khách. Mức thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng là 125USD/tháng. Chị đề nghị được vay 625USD ở vòng vốn này để mua thêm máy móc mở rộng hoạt động kinh doanh của mình.

loans.use: Buy tools for her beauty salon

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đoàn Thị Huế, 35 years old, brews rice liquor and processes grain for people in the village. She has been doing this line of work for 5 years. Her business needs capital, that’s why she joins the TYM Fund. In the beginning she started with small loans then gradually increases though the years. Her husband, a driver, helps her with household chores. They have a son and a daughter. The average monthly income is 250USD. The round she is applying for a loan of 1200USD to buy grain for their milling operation. 

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đoàn Thị Huế, 35 tuổi, làm nghề nấu rượu và máy xay xát được gần 5 năm nay. Chị chuyên xay ngô, đỗ các loại ngũ cốc phục vụ cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Công việc đòi hỏi có nhiều vốn nên chị Huế đã chủ động xin tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương. Những vòng đầu chị xin vay những mức vốn nhỏ để làm quen với cách trả tuần. Mức vốn vay tăng dần lên qua các năm tham gia. Chồng chị, một lái xe rất chịu khó luôn giúp đỡ chị mọi công việc nhà khi có thời gian rảnh rỗi. Anh chị có 2 con 1 trai, 1 gái. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của cả gia đình là 250USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay số vốn là 1200USD để mua nguyên liệu (ngô, đỗ) phục vụ nhu cầu ngày càng lớn của bà con trong xã.

loans.use: Buy maize, bean to grind

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hà Thị Thưa, 51 years old, is a member of TYM fund branch 4 Kim Động. Her husband is a farmer. They have 1 child who is in adulthood. Mrs Thưa's main occupation is farming and raising pigs. She supplies pork for consumers in her village. Each year, she sends 4 batches of pigs to the slaughter house which brings her a sizeable sum of money each time. Her family income is about 200 USD a month. After 10 years with TYM, this time she wishes to obtain a loan of 950 USD to buy pigs and mash in order to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hà Thị Thưa, 51 tuổi, là thành viên Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 4 Kim Động. Chị sống cùng chồng, một nông dân và 1 người con đã trưởng thành. Công việc chính của chị Thưa là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Chị chuyên chăn nuôi lợn cung cấp thực phẩm cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Trung bình mỗi năm chị xuất chuồng 4 lứa lợn. Sau mỗi lứa lợn xuất chuồng gia đình lại có một khoản thu nhập kha khá. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình là 200USD. Sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, chị mong muốn được vay mức vốn 950USD để mua thêm lợn con và thức ăn gia súc, mở rộng chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs and mash

loans.name: Maksudhoja

texts.en:
Maksudhoja is 30 years old and married with 3 children. The two older children attend school and the younger is only 3 years old.

Maksudhoja has been running his business for 2 years. With his wife's assistance he fries and bakes pasties and patties with meat. They also operate a small snack-bar serving pasties and patties. Maksudhoja and his wife are very nice and polite people, whose friendly service has attracted many clients to their business. They depend on the revenue generated by their business to support their family.

Today Maksudhoja requests US$600 to buy plates and dishes for his business and to repair the roof of his small snack-bar. This is Maksudhoja's first loan. He plans to work hard to pay back the loan in 6 months and not to let down all the people who decide to support him.

loans.use: Purchasing of plates and dishes, repair of the roof

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 37 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund, Kim Động branch 4. She lives with her husband and 3 school age children in Phú Cường, Hưng Yên province. They sell construction material and have been in this business for 15 years now. They build enough good reputation that their shop is always busy with customers. The monthly income of the shop is about 240USD. She would like to take out a loan of 950USD to buy more goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 37 tuổi, là thành viên Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 4 Kim Động. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Phú Cường, Hưng Yên. Cả 3 cháu nhà chị T. đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Kinh doanh nguyên vật liệu là công việc chính của 2 vợ chồng chị. Anh chị làm công việc này được 15 năm. Cửa hàng chuyên bán buôn bán lẻ các loại nguyên vật liệu dùng cho xây dựng. Do buôn bán giữ uy tín nên người dân trong xã khi có nhu cầu đều đến cửa hàng của chị T.. T. nhập bình quân 1 tháng từ cửa hàng là 240USD. Chị T. muốn vay mức vốn là 950USD để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu về bán.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Ngần, 40 years old, has been with the TYM Fund for 5 years. She lives with her husband, an industrious farmer, and two school age children. Since raising pigs business is a norm in her village, she choose to farm corn to make feeds for pigs. She’s been doing this for 15 years now. Her corn has big grains that make people in the village prefer hers more than from other farmers. She has a quarter of an acre corn field. The income from this corn business is 200USD a month. In addition, she farms a half acre rice paddy and raises 4 pigs. She would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to buy fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Ngần, 40 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương được 5 năm. Chị sống cùng chồng, một người nông dân hiền lành, chất phác và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Nhận thấy chăn nuôi lợn là một công việc phổ biến trong vùng, nhu cầu về thức ăn gia súc lớn nên chị Ngần chọn công việc trồng ngô làm thức ăn chăn nuôi. Chị đã làm việc này được 15 năm. Ngô chị trồng hạt to, mẩy nên được bà con rất ưu thích. Hiện tại chị Ngần có 3 sào đất trồng ngô. Thu nhập bình quân từ công việc này là 200USD/tháng. Ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi 4 con lợn và làm 6 sào ruộng. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay mức vốn 1200USD để đầu tư mua thêm phân bón phục vụ cho trồng trọt.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Merta Giri Kusuma Group

texts.id:
Merta Giri Kusuma group, located in Candikusuma village, was formed by several community members who were interested in raising hogs. They learned that Dinari foundation will provide assistance and financial loan for those who are interested in hogs farming. The eight member group, chaired by I Nengah Reka, Dayu Ketut Sukeni as secretary and Ni Komang Suparwati as treasurer, is requesting for the financial loan and technical assistance to Dinari foundation. After obtaining proper training and assistance, such as how to raise the hogs and not wasting money on animal feed and how to quickly manage hogs desease, Merta Giri Kusuma group is seeking financial loan from Dinari Foundation to buy quality piglets and animal feed. By doing so it hopes to provide better results than that of doing a more traditional hogs farming that some members used to do in the past. With the asssitance and financial support from the Dinari Foundation, the Merta Giri Kusuma is poised that its business will be growing well and succesful.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Kelompok Merta Giri Kusuma berlokasi di dusun Candikusuma, terbentuk karena keinginan dari beberapa masyarakat yang menekuni usaha beternak babi Karena mereka mendengar berita bahwa Yayasan Dinari memberi pembinaan serta pinjaman modal untuk masyarakat yang ingin mengembangkan usaha beternak babi. Dengan anggota sebanyak 8 orang ,yang diketuai oleh I Nengah Reka, Sekretaris Dayu Ketut Sukeni dan bendahara Ni Komang Suparwati, maka kelompok Merta Giri Kusuma mengajukan permohonan pinjaman dan pembinaan tersebut ke Yayasan Dinari. Setelah mendapat pembinaan serta pelatihan yang cukup seperti bagaimana cara beternak babi yang baik dan benar,cara mengatur keuangan rumah tangga agar modal untuk beternak babi tidak habis untuk biaya makan serta cara penanggulangan penyakit babi yang cepat dan tepat, maka Kelompok Merta giri Kusuma mendapat pinjaman modal dari Yayasan Dinari untuk membeli bibit unggul dan pakan ternak yang berkwalitas ,maksudnya agar hasil yang diperoleh akan lebih bagus daripada memelihara babi lokal ,yang selama ini mereka tekuni. Dengan adanya pembinaan dan dukungan Modal dari Yayasan Dinari maka kelompok Merta Giri Kusuma berkeyakinan bahwa usahanya akan sukses dan berkembang bagus.

loans.use: To buy quality piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en:
Ibodat is 26 years old. She and her husband-entrepreneur have two small wonderful kids

Ibodat is a seamstress. When she was a girl, Ibodat was trained by her grandmother to sew Tajikistan's national dresses and national quilts. In Tajikistan the national dresses are very beautiful and an important part of the dowry for any girl. The national quilts are also very popular as they are widely used in the country. People use them as mattresses and blankets. Ibodat sews the dresses and quilts in her house and sells them from there.

Ibodat has been an IMON client for more than 2 years already. She has paid all of her loans on time. Now Ibodat requests US$500 for which she plans to purchase fabrics for sewing the national dresses and quilts. Ibodat is sure she will repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of new fabrics for sewing national dresses and national quilts

loans.name: Sayu Putu Murdani

texts.id:
Sayu Putu Murdani is a restless homemaker. She makes her trip to the market early in the morning to buy food to be resold later. Later in the day Murdani goes door to door doing sewing and alteration. Beside that, Murdani raises four hogs, two sows and two boars since in her village people rarely want to raise boars (to be used as breeders). In addition to the income from each piglet produced by the sows, Murdani also earns some money from breeding her boars to the neigbors' sows. She earns 50,000 IDR (~5.30 USD) for each breeding. Hence her income from the boars depends on the demand. Feeding the boars is not much different than that of the sows, except for additional supplements and formula to increase the boars stamina. Her profit is used to pay for her child's education at the Udayana University in Denpasar (in 3rd semester). Murdani hopes to use the loan to fix the hog pen.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sayu Putu Murdani seorang ibu rumah tangga yang tidak bisa tinggal diam. Dari pagi Murdani sudah kepasar membeli bahan-bahan makanan yang nantinya akan dijual kembali.Siang hari Murdani mulai berkeliling sambil mencari jejahitan (canang) karena Murdani juga sebagai pengepul. Disamping itu Murdani juga memelihara babi sebanyak 4 ekor, 2 ekor induk babi dan 2 ekor pejantan karena di desanya masih jarang orang yang mau memelihara Babi jantan ( yang akan dipergunakan untuk pejantan ).Disamping pendapatan yang diperoleh dari anak yang dilahirkan oleh induk babi Murdani juga mendapatkan pemasukan dari pejantan yang Murdani miliki karena setiap satu kali mengawini babi tetangga yang birahi Murdani mendapatkan pemasukan Rp 50.000 untuk satu ekor dan satu kali kawin.Jadi pendapatan yang diperoleh dari babi jantan tidak menentu karena tergantung dari orang –orang yang membutuhkan jasa Pejantan.Untuk makanan yang diberikan untuk babi jantan tidak jauh berbeda hanya saja setiap kali babi jantan pulang dari disewakan harus diberi makan tambahan berupa jamu dan juga campuran telor ayam dan madu untuk menambah kekuatan Pejantan. Dari keuntungan yang di peroleh dipakai untuk membiayai anaknya yang sedang kuliah di Denpasar di Universitas Udayana semester 3. Murdani berharap pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari akan dipergunakan untuk memperbaiki kandang agar lebih baik.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Mahkamhoja

texts.en:
M. Mahkamhoja is 54 years old. He and his wife, who is keeps their house, have raised 3 children. The children are already married and have their own kids who adore their grandparents.

Mahkamhuja has been a cattleman for 9 years. He has 1 cow and 2 sheep. His business is stable and generates significant income for the family.

Mahkamhoja has been already provided with several loans by IMON and has shown himself to be a responsible borrower with positive credit history. Today Mahkamhoja requests US$500 to buy one cow and fodder. He promises to repay the loan in 6 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Zulfia

texts.en:
Zulfia T. is a 34 year-old loving mother of two children,  the younger is only 4 years old. Her husband is a mechanic. 

For more than 6 years Zulfia is selling the fish in the central fish market of the city. She is pictured with her customers at her fish stall. When she started she had only US$300 in turnover. With time her business expanded and today it is quite a stable business with a working capital of US$2,000. 

Zulfia is requesting US$500 for 12 months. She wants to purchase fish in bulk for selling in the spring season, when fishing is prohibited. Zulfia has already received previous loans from IMON and shown herself to be a reliable client. She would to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing fish wholesale

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is an active client of our organization and has been involved since 06.07.2007. His first loan was taken out to purchase high quality modern clothes. He said that MicroInvest helped him to increase his working capital and attract new clients with a modern assortment of clothing. Husein lives with his parents who helped him to start his own business. After graduation from secondary school his father helped him rent a stall in the Big Market "Korvon", Dushanbe, Tadjikistan. Husein's friend Askar, who has a stall next to Husein, brings goods from Bishkek and is responsible for supplying goods to Husein's trading place. Husein wishes to make the trip himself, but he is unable to afford to do so at this time.

He hopes to receive a loan from the KIVA program to increase the volume of his goods and collect money for a trip to Bishkek. (In the photo, you can see Husein on the right and Askar on the left.)

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
K. Rahmatullo is 39 years old. He is married with three children and his wife is a housekeeper.

Rahmatullo has been working with IMON for more than three years and has a positive credit history. For more than 12 years he has been running a small open café where he cooks kebabs. His café is located inside the food market of the city. Rahmatullo's children are growing up fast -- his the elder daughter is 16 years old and will enter university this year, while his younger daughter and son are 14 and 12 correspondingly. Rahmatullo needs to prepare a dowry for his elder daughter but unfortunately does not earn enough income for this.

Rahmatullo is requesting a loan of 3000.00 Somoni (US$875) to increase his capital and expand his business, promising to repay the loan in 3 months. Rahmatullo hopes that by being able to generate a good income, he will help his daughter to enter university and will also have the funds for to pay his daughter's dowry and arrange his elder daughter's wedding.

loans.use: To enlarge his working capital and to use the income generated to pay for his daughter's university education and her wedding.

loans.name: Mugongo A4(I) Group

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and married with four children. Her current business is selling used clothes. With the extra business profits earned from this loan, she intends to start a poultry business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Mugongo A4(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 28 years old and married with five children. She has a canteen business and mainly sells snacks and groceries. She wants to use the profits from this loan to start selling clothing also.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store business

loans.name: Ziver

texts.en: Ziver is a resident of Sumgayit town. She is married and has three children. She has a small shed in her yard and she raises goats and sheep there. She sells milk and meat products. She sells sheep and goats to butchers in the local market. Thus she earns a living for the family. She has a few head of animals and wants to increase the number of her animals. She applies for a loan from Normicro Sumgayit as she has almost no funds of her own. She needs $400 for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam is 28 years old, married and has 2 children. His main business is trade in different kinds of rice and he is also fond of cattle breeding at home. He buys his rice from districts further away, including Hisor, Dushanbe, and Regar, Dushanbe. At home he has two bulls and 4 sheep. Rustam has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and his current turnover of working capital is fast. He has all kinds of rice and always tries to have a large enough volume to enable him to keep up such a fast turnover. From KIVA he wants to receive a loan to purchase the next sacks of rice from the Regar region.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Ms. Gulnar is a low-income, vulnerable woman (her brother is pictured). She is 25 and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region. Gulnar and her brother run the family business together. Gulnar sells beef in the Saatli town while her brother grazes cattle. The income from four cows they have is too low to support the family. That’s why Gulnar applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $600 loan to buy four calves to make her monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region, the price of a good calf is about $100 or more.

loans.use: To buy calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Seadet

texts.en: Seadet is a resident of Sumgayit town located northwest of the capital, Baku (her husband is pictured). She runs an industrial and home products shop together with her husband Maharram. They have been in this business for more than three years. This shop is their only source of income. They want to develop their business, increase turnover and thus increase their income. Seatet applied to Normicro Sumgayit branch for a loan of $500 for the first time. She and her husband will buy more goods for the shop and repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods

loans.name: Mugongo A4(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother of two children. She has a hotel business and needs more equipment to keep this going well. She would use the loan and the profits earned to buy more house furniture and to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy food warmers.

loans.name: Gunel

texts.en: Ms. Gunel is a 28-year-old low-income married woman with two children (her brother is pictured). She is a farmer. She lives with her people in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2003 when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Gunel and her brother purchase calves, breed them, and sell to the butcher in the local bazaar. The income is not enough to cover all of Gunel’s family expenses. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Gunel has to invest some money to make her small herd bigger. This summer she applied for $600 to buy four calves.  She hopes eventually to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mugongo B1(A) Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a single mother of two children. She owns a retail shop and mainly sells household products. With the profits from this loan, she wants to buy land in the village.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory of household goods in her shop

loans.name: Mohammad Nasim

texts.en:
Mohammad Nasim lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has one son. He lives with his own family. His father died during the war in Kabul.

Mohammad is also supporting his mother and one small brother with his retail shop. He started this business 4 years ago in Kabul. He has attracted good numbers of customers so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his inventory so as to make a good monthly income for his family. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To complete items missing in his inventory

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Since childhood, Jane M. has wanted to own big boutique in Lugazi. She opened up a small shop in 1993 which has grown steadily with time. To date, Jane’s shop is worth $2300 and she has been able to build a permanent house to live in.

Jane is married to a very hard working man who is also supportive. She is 49 years of age and has five children and two dependents. Jane’s business helps support her family and place her children in good schools.

Jane has good taste in clothing for both women and men, a rare talent in women. Her clothes are bought very fast and in one month she replenishes her stock at least three times. It is her wish to access more funding to cut the transportion costs as well as maintain the right stock levels.

loans.use: Jane wants to buy a box of ladies clothing and shoes

loans.name: Zinyet

texts.en: Zinyat is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region located in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. She and her family of her husband and two children were relocated to Sumgayit as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She is engaged in mobile household goods sales. She travels with the goods and sometimes sells them from her house. She has many good clients that know her and buy goods from her. Now she is a bit short in her goods. She has taken loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch and successfully repaid them back. Now she applies again for the fourth time for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the number of goods

loans.name: Mugongo B1 (B) Group

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old and married with three children. She sells milk for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy milk cans.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her milk business

loans.name: Mugongo B1 (C) Group

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and a single mother of two children. She has a market stall and mainly sells raw foods. She wants to build a house in the village with the extra business profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more foods for sale

loans.name: Maijuma

texts.en: Fast food in Uganda was not common to local towns in the past. However, it is becoming a better choice for a number of people, especially those traveling and others with minimum time to spend eating. The economic demands force people to utilize every minute by eating something small to keep them moving. Having seen this trend, N. started up a fast food outlet in Lugazi. She draws customers from banks, wholesale shops and travelers, since it is located near the highway to Jinja, which continues to Kenya. She prepares chips, fried chicken, samosas, sausages, and pillawo (spicy fried rice). She is a welcoming lady and knows how to handle customers. Having succeeded in the snacks business, she wants to start a salon. She believes she will use her experience to run both businesses well.

loans.use: Maijuma wants to open a salon in Lugazi

loans.name: Zulfida

texts.en: Zulfida is a refugee from the Tartar region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, in the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone. She lives in Sumgayit town now. She sells clothing near the marketplace. She is in this business for more than 10 years. She has taken loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch before and successfully paid back her loans. She wants to increase the number and variety of her goods and she has little of her own funds. She applies again for a loan. She will repay the loan in 14 months.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Mekhriban

texts.en: Ms. Mekhriban is a low-income, vulnerable woman (her husband is shown). She is 47, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Mekhriban and her husband run the family business together. Mekhriban sells milk in the Saatli town while her husband takes care of their cows. The income from such a small herd is too low to support the family That’s why Mekhriban applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy a milk cow to make her monthly income higher.

loans.use: To buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Yakuwa Wakimese A Group

texts.en:
Madian is 40 years old and a single mother of two children. She is a poultry farmer. She wants to use the extra business profits to bring more chicks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets for the poultry house

loans.name: Yakuwa Wakimese B Group

texts.en:
Annet is 29 years old and married with four children. She has a retail shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to add to her capital and also pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the shop

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en: Bahruz is an Internally Displaced Person from the Gubadli region located in the southeast part of Azerbaijan. He and his family were relocated to Sumgayit city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. He trades fruits and vegetables. He has been in this business for more than 4 years. He wants to increase the volume of sales as it is low at the moment, invest more in his business, and increase the income. He has had two previous loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch. Now he applies again for $800, to invest in business.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Yakuwa Wakimese C Group

texts.en:
Noeline is 34 years old and married with four children. She has a retail shop. She wants to use the extra profits to take her children to better schools for a good quality education.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her retail shop

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en: Nazile is an Internally Displaced Person from the Gubadli region located in the southeastern part of Azerbaijan. She and her family of her husband and one child were relocated to Sumgayit as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She is engaged in mobile clothing sales. She travels with the goods and sometimes sells them from her house. She has many good clients that know her and buy goods from her. She has taken loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch and successfully repaid them back. Now she applies again for the third time for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the number and variety of items

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
The saying “start small and grow up, start big and blow up” is the guiding principle for K. Jamil. He started producing animal feed ten years ago and has never turned back. He processes cattle and chicken feed out of maize husks, small fish, cow bones and snail shells. He has a milling machine and a mixer which he uses to produce the feed. In a day, he produces 20 bags, which in most cases are already ordered by clients. Jamil got the idea of starting a business when he was working with UGACHICK, a local breeding and animal feed processing plant in Kampala.

K. and his wife are blessed with 5 children whom they provide with all the necessities of life. K. is 39 years of age and hopes to erect a commercial building in Lugazi Town before he is 45 years. He is an honest person and delivers all orders as requested. This has led to an increased number of customers. The business is growing very fast, thus the need for more funding.

loans.use: Kayiwa wants to buy 2 tonnes of maize grain to process animal feed

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman is a resident of Sumgayit. He is married and has three children. He has a barber shop. He has 17 years in this business and has many good clients. He wants to buy some new tools for his barber shop. He heard about Normicro loans and applied to the Sumgayit branch for the first time. He wants to borrow $400.

loans.use: To buy tools

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Baloghlan

texts.en: Baloghlan is 47 years old and a resident of Sumgayit Town of Azerbaijan. He works as a taxi driver with his own car in Sumgayit. He works inside the town and sometimes goes long distances, such as to Baku and other regions. His car is an old model and brakes down if he goes longer distances. He wants to repair his car. As he has little of his own funds for that, he applies to Normicro Sumgayit branch to borrow $400 for repairing his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kwegata Wakimese Group

texts.en:
Roy is 29 years old and married with two children. She has a retail shop. She wants to start up a poultry business with the extra profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Shovgi

texts.ru:
Shovgi A. was born in 1971 in the city and currently lives in the Agsunisky region. He is married. Five years ago he started his own business. He has been working hard and actively moving forward. Now he needs the loan to help expand his business and this year he decided to turn to Normicro.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Шовги 1971 года рождения. Родился и проживает в Ахсуниском районе. Семейный. Пять лет тому назад начинал этот бизнес. Благодаря своему усилие активно двигался вперед. Нужны были средство чтобы расширятся. По этому в этом году он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: To increase livestock

loans.name: Nabaziza A (I) Group

texts.en:
Ths group has been together or one year. Kevin and Ponsiano both have poultry businesses. Christine has a bar business. Victoria sells charcoal for a living. With the extra business profits, Kevin intends to construct another poultry house and also buy more chicks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in poultry business

loans.name: Nabaziza A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Sylvia sells used clothes for a living. Betty and Esther are poultry farmers and want to use the loan to expand their businesses. Rehema has a beauty salon while Allen has a retail shop. Sylvia wants to use the extra business profits to increase stock in her clothes selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru:
Anar B. was born in 1981 in the Agsunisky region. He recently got married. He has been breeding livestock for the past four years. This young man is seriously involved in his business. In 2007 he applied for a loan from Normicro. Anar hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бабакишиев Анар родился 1981 году в Ахсуниском районе. Недавно женился. Уже четыре года подряд занимается скотоводством. Этот молодой человек серезно занимается этим бизнесом. 2007 году написал заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Анар надеятся получив кредит расширять свой бизнес.

loans.use: To increase livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is a resident of Baku, but she lives in Sumgayit City now. She has been engaged in mobile clothing and household goods sales for three years. She travels with the goods and sometimes sells them from her house. She has many good clients that know her and buy goods from her. Now she is a bit short in her goods. She has taken loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch and successfully repaid them back. Now she applies again for a loan to increase the number of her items in inventory that she sells.

loans.use: To increase the number and variety of goods

loans.name: Nabaziza A (Iii) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Marx sells livestock. Teo is a livestock farmer and wants to use the loan to buy a calf. Berna has a poultry business and intends to purchase more broilers. Jane has a photo studio and wants to use the loan to buy a generator. Ruth owns a small bar.

loans.use: To add in firewood business

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru:
Elnur G. was born in 1978. He currently lives in the Agsunisky region. He is a bachelor, but plans to get married soon. Last year he filed an application at Normicro. Elnur plans to use the loan to buy more cows. This will help him expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Эльнур Гасымов 1978 года рождения. Данный момент проживает в Ахсуниском районе.Холость. Скоро собирается жениться. В прошлом году обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Эльнур получив кредит хочеть купит еще несколько коров. Это поможет ему расширятся.

loans.use: To increase livestock

loans.name: Nabaziza B Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Jane  has a retail shop business. Florence and Hamida are stone quarriers and want to use the loan to re-invest in the business. Faltia has a brick-laying business while Harriet sells used shoes. With the extra business profits, Jane wants to purchase another fridge for her retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Senuber

texts.ru:
Senuber N. was born in 1951 in a village of Padarkishlak of the Agsunisky region. She has been breeding livestock for more than fifteen years. Last year she took out a loan for $300 from Normicro. She used it to buy hay for the cattle. This time she wants to use the loan to buy a few more cows.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сенубер Нифталыева 1951 года рождения. Родилась и проживает в село Падаркышлак Ахсуниского района. Более пятьнадцати лет занимается скотоводством. Прошлом году она взяла кредит в Нормикро Ахсуниского филиала триста долларов. На эти средство купила сену. Теперь она хочеть взять еще кредит, чтобы купить еще несколько коров.

loans.use: To increase livestock

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.ru:
Sadiq H. was born in 1981 in the village Padarkishlak in Agsu region. He is single, but is planning to get married soon. He started his business recently. Sadiq enjoys his business and would like to see it grow. But in order to expand his business he needs money to buy more animals, that’s why Sadiq is applying for a loan from Normicro, Agsu branch. This young man seeks help.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Садык Халилов родился 1981 году в село Падаркышлак Ахсуниского района. Холост, но скоро у него будет свадьба . Недавно начинал этот бизнес. Любя свою работу он хочет его расширять. Но для этого ему нужны деньги. По этому Садык обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.Этому молодому человеку надо помочь

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Nabaziza C Group

texts.en: Cathy has a stone quarrying business. Sarah is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to bring more chicks. Gladys wants to buy a fridge for her hotel. Angel has a bar and intends to buy more furniture with the loan. With the extra business profits, Cathy wants to start up a market stall.

loans.use: To buy more land for stone quarrying

loans.name: Nabaziza C Group

texts.en: Cathy has a stone quarrying business. Sarah is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to bring more chicks. Gladys wants to buy a fridge for her hotel. Angel has a bar and intends to buy more furniture with the loan. With the extra business profits, Cathy wants to start up a market stall.

loans.use: To buy more land for stone quarrying

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru:
Maruf H. lives in Khujand, he is 42 and has three children. Maruf’s wife sells goods in the market. Maruf drives a private taxi. He has been driving a taxi for the past 20 years. Maruf makes long distant trips through mountain passes to and from Dushanbe. He needs to repair his car. Maruf does not have enough money to pay for repairs as winter is not a profitable period for him, since he cannot make the long distant trips because of the ice on the roads in the mountain passes. Maruf decided to apply for a loan with Macroinvest.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хасанов Маруф, житель г. Худжанда, возрост 42 года имеет 3 детей работает водителем частного такси.Имеет 20 лет стажа в этой работе .Жена Хсанова Зульфия торгует на рынке мелкой розницей.Сам Маруф ездит в дальние рейсы через перевал в г.Душанбе,поэтому у него возникла проблема с ремонтом автомобиля.Но из-за того что зимний период не прибыльное и не сезонное время из-за скользких дорог, поэтому у него не достаточно финансов для ремонта. Маруф решил кредитоваться для этой цели в Микроинвесте.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Nabaziza C (I) Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for one year. Zaina is 35 years old and married with eight children. She has a tailoring business and also sells new clothes. Teddy and Noeline are poultry farmers and want to use the loan to expand their businesses. Margret wants to build a piggery shelter with the loan. Alice owns a retail shop. Zaina intends to buy a serging machine for designing clothes with the extra business profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more bitenge cloth

loans.name: Nabingo 3 (A) Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for one year. Robinah has a market stall and sells raw foods. Marx and Rose are poultry farmers and want to use the loan to construct more poultry houses. Oliver is a tailor and wants to use the loan to buy a Bablock machine. Agnes is a stone quarrier. With the extra business profits, Robinah wants to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets for her market stall for shade.

loans.name: Nabingo 3 (B) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Margret is 34 years old and married with three children. She is a dairy livestock farmer. With the extra business profits, she wants to buy more land for brick laying.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feeds.

loans.name: Nabingo 3 (C) Group

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Mary and Agnes have retail shop businesses. Mary wants to increase the stock in her retail shop with the loan. Teo and Clairet have market stalls and sell raw foods. Margret runs a beauty salon and wants to buy hairdryers with the loan.

loans.use: To invest in her retail shop

loans.name: Nabingo 3 (D) Group

texts.en: Sauda S. is 32 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a super market.  She intends to use the extra profits to re-invest in the super market.  K. has a piggery business and wants to use the loan to buy pig feeds. Kirunda K. and Betty Namiremebe both have beauty salons and want to use the loan to buy more salon equipment. Mary N. wants to use the loan to purchase furniture for her hotel. Sande K. has a market stall and wants to purchase more raw foods for sale. Rose N. has a retail shop business and wants to buy more shop items.

loans.use: To add stock in her supermarket

loans.name: Muhsinhodja

texts.ru:
Muhsinhodja R. is 25 years old. He has twin sisters who are getting married soon. He wants to give each of his twin sisters a gold ring as a wedding gift. Muhsinhodja works at the Youth Center. He has never taken out loan before. He can’t afford to pay cash for the rings, so is applying for a loan. He thinks that any woman would be happy to receive a gift like that.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Рустамов Мухсинходжа молодой человек в возросте 25 лет брат двух сестер блезняшек,которым хочет подарить на свадьбу два золотых кольца.Мухсинходжа работает в секторе по делам молодежи раньше нигде не кредитовался .Он считает что чем купить за наличные ему выгодней купить в кредит.Ведь такому подарку будет рада любая женщина.

loans.use: Purchase of jewerly

loans.name: Mirembe Kinaawa (A) Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 30 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a medical researcher. She has a retail shop business. She wants to use the extra profits to expand into a wholesale business. Mary and Rita sell used clothes and intend to increase their stock with the loan. Rosemary has a canteen business while Jennifer sells raw foods.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in stock in the retail shop.

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede O. is 35 years old, married with four children and lives in the town of Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells frozen fish for a living, and has been in this business since 1989. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more  fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more frozen fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mirembe Kinaawa (B) Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a single mother of two children. Her current business is fish selling. Joyce usually earns shs 30,000 in profits weekly. She wants to use the extra business profits to start up a poultry business. Gladys and Hellen sell African crafts. Margret has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to expand the business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Mirembe Kinaawa (C) Group

texts.en:
Annet is 25 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Annet, Mastulla and Maria all have poultry businesses. Annet sees an opportunity of diversifying her business to a piggery. With the extra business profits, Annet wants to construct another poultry house. Barbara sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Olayinde

texts.en: Olayinde A. is 45 years old, married with four children and lives in the town of Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has sold frozen food for a living since 1989, and became a LAPO client in 2004. Olayinde is seeking a loan of $450 to  buy more frozen food to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food

loans.name: Romoke

She sells clothes for a living, and has been in this line of work for the last eight years. She has been a LAPO member for three years, and has applied for a $450 loan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mirembe Kinaawa (D)B Group
