She also purchases cows and pigs to sell their meat at the Mache district. Her storage was very small and she had very few products for sale. Thanks to the loan she got from the “Women at Work” comunal bank she was able to expand it. With her first loan was of S/. 300.00 she purchased rice, sugar and noodles. With the S/.1,000.00, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 18 small pigs to fatten them and sell them alive or sacrifice them.

Her dream is to be a great entrepeneur, to sell wholesale and regular groceries around Mache and Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Paulina María tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria, en total tiene 3 hijos y aún 2 dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. En su domicilio ha colocado una tienda donde vende abarrotes como azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos, etc., también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, ovejas y gallinas, los cuales vende los domingos en la feria de Julcán, asimismo compra reses y cerdos para la venta de su carne, esto lo distribuye en el camal y en los restaurantes del distrito de Mache. Su bodega era muy pequeña y tenía pocos productos y gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido en el banco comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” ha podido implementarla. Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 y con este dinero compró arroz, azúcar y fideos. Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 18 cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y venderlos vivos o sacrificarlos posteriormente. El sueño de la señora Paulina es ser una gran empresaria, vender abarrotes al por mayor y menor por Mache y la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: Compra de animales (cerdos)

loans.name: Segunda Violeta

texts.es:
Mrs. Segunda Violeta is 44 years old. She finished highschool. She has a son who is older and does not economically depend on her. She lives in the Porvenir disctrict on the Trujillo province in the state of La Libertad.

Mrs. Segunda travels to Mache every weekend to purcahse pigs, rams, chickens and guinnea pigs. She also purchases wholesale fresh cheese, which she uses to produce other forms of cheese to sell at different markets in Trujillo.

She used to house cleaner but once her father got seek she had to take over his business.

She is part of the “Progresistas” comunal bank, where she received her first loan of S/. 300.00, which she used to purchase fresh chesse. With the S/. 1,800.00 loan she will purchase 23 pigs, guinnea pigs, chickens and turkeys. She promises to pay back the loan within four months.

Her dream is to purchase a little stand on the “La Rinconada” market in Trujillo city in order to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Segunda Violeta tiene 44 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, tiene un hijo que ya es mayor y no depende de ella, vive en el distrito del Porvenir , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. La señora Segunda viaja a Mache todos los fines de semana para comprar cerdos, carneros, cuyes y gallinas y también compra quesillo al por mayor, el cual produce queso para luego repartirlo por los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Trujillo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como empleada del hogar, pero al enfermar su padre tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio. Es socia del banco comunal “Progresistas”, lugar donde recibió un primer préstamo de S/.300.00, el cual utilizó para comprar cuajada (quesillo). Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará 23 cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y sobre todo pavos. Su anhelo es comprar un puesto en el mercado “La Rinconada” de la ciudad de Trujillo para la venta de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase animals (pigs, guinnea pigs, chickens, turkeys)

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
Asunción is 49 years old and has been separated from her husband for many years. Alone, she had to take on the responsibility of raising two children, who today are married and have formed their own families.

Asunción is the owner of a haberdashery that is located insaide the municipal market of Itá. She began this activity 15 years ago and travels every day from the city of Guarambaré (half an hour from Itá) in order to open her business and tend to her customers.

Asunción works seven days a week, even on rainy days and holidays. Her business is her sole source of income. Thanks to her hard work and effort she has been able to provide her home with furniture and electric appliances.

Among the many products she sells are clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children. She also markets commodities for the home such as sheets, towels, vases, plates, and silverware. She dreams that her business would grow every day so this way she can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Asunción tiene 49 años, está separada desde hace varios años y sola tuvo que afrontar la responsabilidad de criar a dos hijos que hoy día ya están casados y han formado sus propias familias.

Asunción es propietaria de una mercería que funciona dentro del mercado municipal de Itá. Cuenta que comenzó con la actividad hace 15 años y que viaja todos los días desde la ciudad de Guarambaré (ciudad que queda a media hora de Itá) para abrir su negocio y atender a su numerosa clientela.

Asunción trabaja de lunes a lunes, aún en los días de lluvia y feriados, pues según nos cuenta ese negocio es su único sustento. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado equipar de comodidades su hogar con muebles y electrodomésticos.

Entre las cosas que vende podemos citar: ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, también vende artículos para la casa como sábanas, toallas, vasos, platos, cubiertos, etc. Sueña con que su negocio crezca día a día y de esta manera generar cada vez más ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, jeans, shirts, cloths, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Critóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal is 35 years old and his wife Nancy is 31. They have been married for 12 years and two beautiful 11 and 6 year-old children has been the result of their union. Both children are in elementary school.

Cristóbal dedicates himself to the cultivation and sale of all types of vegetables. His work day begins very early, due to the fact that he must leave his house at 3 A.M. every day to get himself to the Abasto Market with the purpose of marketing his cultivated products. The market is an hour away from the city of Itá. Once he sells all of his vegetables he returns home at around 9 A.M. to work in the field.

Thanks to his hard work and effort of 15 years in this line of work, Cristóbal has been able to raise enough money to build his own home and buy himself a truck that he uses for the transport of vegetables to their sales destination.

For this year his big project is to open a chicken business in his home (a place where cooked chickens are sold and ready to eat). This way he will be able to obtain greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Cristóbal tiene 35 años y su esposa Nancy tiene 31 años. Están casados hace 12 años y fruto de la unión han nacido dos hermosos hijos de 11 y 6 años respectivamente. Ambos niños van a la escuela primaria.

Cristóbal se dedica al cultivo y venta de todo tipo de hortalizas. Su día de trabajo comienza muy temprano debido que debe trasladarse todos los días a las 03:00 am. hasta el Mercado de Abasto de la ciudad capital (queda a una hora de la ciudad de Itá), con el fin de comercializar sus productos cultivados. Una vez que vende todas sus hortalizas el regresa a su casa alrededor de las 9:00 am. para trabajar en su chacra.

Gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo de más de 15 años en la profesión ha logrado reunir el dinero suficiente para hacerse de casa propia y comprarse un camión que utiliza para el traslado de las hortalizas hasta los puntos de venta.

Tiene como proyecto para este año abrir una pollería (negocio en donde se venden pollos cocinados y listos para comer) en su casa y así obtener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of tomato seed, lettuce, fertilizer, and tools

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is 57 years old and has been married for 24 years to Blásida, who is 46 years old. Their marriage produced 5 children, of which one passed away. Their children are 26, 24, 20, and 11 years old respectively. The two oldest are married while the two younger children live at home with their parents and are in school.

José is the owner of a store that operates out of his own house, while his wife tends to the home. His business is very well stocked has a very good customer base. He sells sodas, fruits, vegetables, canned goods, candy, flour, sugar, rice, etc.

In addition to the store, José has a premises for parties, which he rents for events like marriages, birthdays, and popular music concerts among other things. For 15 years he has dedicated himself to these activities. In the future he would like to be able to obtain some land to use for feeding a cattle herd. He requests this loan in order to buy more merchandise for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

José tiene 57 años y está casado hace 24 años con Blásida que tiene 46 años. El matrimonio tuvo 5 hijos de los cuales uno falleció. Sus hijos tienen 26, 24 , 20 y 11 años respectivamente. Los dos mayores ya están casados mientras que los dos últimos aún viven con ellos y están estudiando.

José es propietario de una despensa que funciona en su casa propia mientras que su esposa cuida el hogar. Su negocio está muy bien surtido y cuenta con buena clientela ya formada. Vende gaseosas, frutas, hortalizas, productos enlatados, golosinas, harina, azúcar, arroz, etc.

Además de su despensa, José, posee un local de fiestas, que alquila para acontecimientos como casamientos, cumpleaños, conciertos de grupos musicales populares entre otros. Comenta que hace 15 años se dedica a tales actividades. Y en el futuro le gustaría poder adquirir un terreno para utilizarlo en el engorde de ganado vacuno. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderías para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, rice, noodles, sugar, meat, canned goods, soda, fruit, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. María is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. She runs a salon out of her own home and has dedicated herself to this activity for more than 18 years. Thanks to her good service she has various clients that visit her salon every week.

With her previous loans that Fundación Paraguaya provided her, María was able to finish up her salon in that it now has all the elements a typical salon should. With the loan she is now requesting, she will invest in the purchase of a variety of hand and foot creams, nail polish, hair dye, and various products that aid in hair treatment.

María often says that thanks to the help of her husband and Fundación Paraguaya she has been able to cover a large part of her family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora María tiene 44 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, posee una peluquería en su mismo domicilio y se dedica al servicio hace más de 18 años, gracias a su buen servicio ella posee numerosas clientelas quiénes acuden a su peluquería cada semana.

Con los préstamos anteriores que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo terminar su salón en dónde tiene todos sus elementos de peluquería, el crédito que solicita en esta ocasión desea invertirlo en la compra de variedad de cremas para manos, para pies, así como pintura para uñas, tintes para el cabello, y diversos productos que ayudan en el tratamiento capilar.

Comenta María que gracias a la ayuda de su marido y el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya ella puede cubrir gran parte de los gastos de la familia.

loans.use: Purchase of hand and foot creams, nail polish, hair dye, hair spray, conditioners, etc

loans.name: Carmen Ita

texts.es:
Carmen Ita is a member of the communal bank "Los Jasmines" and has sold bread and sweets for nine years in the central market of Moyobamba, San Martín. Having had experience before working in this type of work, she decided to start her own business in order to contribute to her household's income. Her products are popular among the local residents, well known for its good quality and hygiene in preparation.

Carmen Ita is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children. Nowadays she feels more confident, independent and capable of making her own decisions. In the future she hopes to have her own premises to install an oven and her own bakery.

With her six month US $525 loan she will stock up on flour, sugar, eggs, oil, butter, salt, and all the other necessary ingredients for her daily preparation of bread and sweets, which she prepares with much care and help from her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen Ita es socia del banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado de abastos. Motivada por la experiencia que tiene en este tipo de trabajo y la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos para ayudar en la economía del hogar decidió dedicarse a la venta de panes y dulces en sus diferentes variedades. Desde hace 9 años sus productos son muy solicitados por los moradores por la buena calidad e higiene. Con el préstamo de S/.1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en jabas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes y otros para la preparación de variados panes y dulces, los cuales los prepara con mucho esmero y con el apoyo de su esposo . Carmen Ita tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Actualmente se siente mas segura, independiente, capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones. Desea en un futuro tener un local propio para construir un horno e instalar su propia panadería.

loans.use: To buy inputs for her bread and sweets business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is 54 years old. He has been married to Emerita for 28 years, and they have a 25 year old son.

Jose owns a workshop where he repairs all types of bicycles, and he also sells spare parts and accessories for the bicycles as well. He has had his business for the past 25 years, after he came back from Argentina, where he work for several years in a bicycle shop, which is where he learnt the business.

His only son helps him with his business, and he mentions delighted that they have many clients that come to him because of the good service that he renders. He is asking for a loan in order to buy spare parts and accessories for the bicycles.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

José tiene 54 años. Está casado hace 28 años con Emérita con quien tiene un solo hijo de 25 años de edad.

José es propietario de un taller en donde se reparan bicicletas de todo tipo y además vende repuestos y accesorios para las mismas. Hace 25 años que montó su propio taller luego de volver de la Argentina (País vecino del Paraguay), en donde trabajó por varios años en una bicicletería y fue allí que aprendió el oficio.

Su único hijo le ayuda en el negocio y comenta muy entusiasmado que tiene muchos clientes que siempre acuden a él por el buen servicio que presta. Solicita el crédito para comprar de repuestos y accesorios para bicicletas.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accesories for his bicycle shop

loans.name: Daysi Yesenia

texts.es:
Daysi Yessenia is a member of the communal bank "The Jasmines" and has operated her candy business for five years located in the central market in Moyobamba, San Martín. She sells traditional sweet breads and sweets, and carries a strong clientele, being well known for making her own delicious products.

Daysi is 26 years old and works day after day with hopes to give her two young children a better future. She likes her work but longs to to have a larger bakery one day.

With her six month US $1,025 loan she will stock up on flour, sugar, eggs, oil, butter, salt, and all the other necessary ingredients for her daily preparation of bread and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Daysi Yessenia es socia del banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de dulces de la región como panes, biscochos, además es muy conocida por elaborar productos sabrosos y de muy buena calidad por lo que tiene una buena clientela. Con el préstamo de S/.3,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses comprará harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en jabas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes, sal en bolsas y otros ingredientes más para la preparación diaria de variados panes y dulces. La señora Daysi tiene 26 años, dos pequeños hijos por quienes día a día trabaja con entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante y darles un futuro mejor. Ella gusta del trabajo que hace pero anhela tener una panadería bien implementada.

loans.use: To buy inputs for bread and sweets production

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a member of the communal bank "The Jasmines," located in Moyabamba, San Martín, Perú. After her experience working at a commercial outlet she decided to start her own business, selling clothes house-to-house, and then eventually opened her own grocery store so as to watch over her youngest children while working. She sells dried goods, bread, vegetables, soft drinks, meat and more.

Esther is 28 years old and since a young age has stood out as a strong-willed woman, hard-working, responsible and persevering. She dreams of opening a restaurant since she she likes to cook and is skilled in the kitchen.

With her six month US $850 loan she plans to stock up on products such as soap, 50 kg sacks of rice, sugar, vegetables, vegetable oil, boxed milk, toilet paper, preserved fish and fruit, snacks, kitchenware, and even clothes for adults and children.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther es socia del banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Dado la experiencia que tenía en la compra y venta de mercadería como empleada de una tienda comercial decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa que los ofrecía casa por casa, luego para poder atender mejor a sus menores hijos instaló en su propia casa del Jr. Oscar Benavides Nº 100 una bodega en la que diariamente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, panes, verduras, bebidas gaseosas, carnes y otros. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón de diferentes marcas, sacos de 50 kilogramos de arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, botellas de aceite en litros, lecha en cajas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, diversas golosinas, además de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y artículos para cocina y de esa manera poder satisfacer el pedido de su basta clientela. Tiene 28 años y desde muy joven se ha destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante. Sueña con tener un restaurante porque también le gusta cocinar y tiene buena sazón. y sobre todo estar en contacto con las demás personas.

loans.use: Stock up on products for her grocery store

loans.name: Kadith

texts.es:
Kadith sells bread and other basic goods in store in Lamas, San Martín, Perú. She started her business with hopes of increasing her income, given that she is a single mother supporting her little son.

She is 33 years old and lives with her son, who gives her the energy and motivation to confront life's adversities. Her dream is to have a "Minimarket" to offer a wide variety of products to her clientele.

With her six month, US $625 loan, Kadith will buy large wooden scaffolding and a scale for her store, and stock up on soft drinks, snacks, boxed milk and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Kadith vive en la región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Lamas. El negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Manco Cápac 145 y se dedica a la venta de pan y otros productos de primera necesidad. Ella emprendió este negocio con la finalidad de tener mayores ingresos, puesto que es madre soltera y tiene que apoyar a su pequeño hijo. Con el préstamo de S/.1,800.00, el cual pagará en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará andamios grandes de madera, una balanza, gaseosas en paquetes, galletas, golosinas, leche en cajas y azúcar en sacos, para ofrecer a su clientela. La señora Kadith tiene 33 años, vive con su hijo, quien es el motor que le da fuerzas para enfrentar las adversidades que se le presenta la vida. Su sueño es tener un Minimarket para ofrecer los más variados productos a su distinguida clientela.

loans.use: To buy assets (scaffolding and a scale) and dry goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Lucre

texts.es:
Lucre is a member of the communal bank "Love and Peace" in Moyobamba, San Martín, Perú. She sells parts for cars, motorcycles and motor-taxis in a repair shop run out of her house. She started the business over a year ago after separating from her husband, wanting to provide her children with a good education, cover all life's daily necessities, and move forward as a woman.

With a 6 month US $425 loan, she will stock up on car parts and a diverse array of accessories to service the daily flow vehicles that come to her shop.

Lucre is 38 years old with 2 children. She is a cheerful woman and a fighter who wants to continue improving her business and in the future hopes to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucre es socia del banco comunal “Amor y Paz” del distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de repuestos y auto partes para motocicletas, motocarros y carros en un taller mecánico ubicado en su propia casa del Jr. Coronel Secada Nº 118 desde hace mas de 1 año al separarse de su esposo y motivada por dar a sus hijos una buena educación y satisfacer las necesidades diarios del hogar y salir adelante como mujer. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará repuestos y accesorios diversos por docena para vehículos motorizados que a diario asisten a su taller de motos para ser reparados y encuentran en este establecimiento lo necesario para seguir circulando. Tiene 38 años, 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Lucre se muestra siempre como una persona jovial y luchadora y anhela desarrollar más su negocio y además desea tener un restaurante.

loans.use: Stock up on motor vehicle parts and accessories

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Ms. María Consuelo is a member of the Santa Ana community bank, located in the Moyabamba province and district, in the department of San Martín. She sells groceries, carbonated beverages, eggs and candy from the home she moved into a short time ago. When she started working as a merchant, she sold fruit, but their sale was not very profitable so she went into selling groceries. With the loan valued at 1,000.00 sols, to be paid in 6 months, she will purchase rice, sacks of sugar, liters of oil, packaged toilet paper, canned fish, soaps and boxes of soap, a variety of candy and refreshments, so that she can provide a diversity of products and satisfy her clients demands. She is 35 years old, married and a mother of three small children. She considers herself independent in managing and controlling her business. She dreams of building a home, having running water, plumbing and electricity and providing her children with a safe place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora María Consuelo es socia del banco comunal “Santa Ana“, ubicado en la provincia y distrito de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas, huevos y golosinas en un ambiente en su propia casa a la que acaba de mudarse hace poco tiempo. En sus inicios como negociante se dedicó a la venta de frutas que no le resulto muy rentable por lo que decidió dedicarse la venta de abarrotes. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado en latas, jaboncillos y jabones en cajas, golosinas diversas, bebidas gaseosas, y de esa manera tener bien surtido el negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos pequeños. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Sueña con construir su casa e instalar servicio de agua, desagüe y luz y dar a sus hijos un lugar seguro donde vivir.

loans.use:
Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, oil, etc.)

Compra de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc)

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Ms. Matilde belongs to the Amor y Paz community bank. She lives in the San Martín region in the Moyabamba province and district. She carries out her business in a stand in the Los Angeles Private Market of that city, where her guests visit everyday from the area or nearby towns. Her experience as a domestic worker allowed her to learn to cook and do it well, reason enough for her to establish her own business selling food a la carte daily. She does so with great pleasure, and her wellbeing has improved because she has been able to meet her children’s needs. With the loan valued at 800.00 sols, to be paid in 6 months, she will purchase the ingredients to prepare meals, such as rice, sugar, wholesale stews, all kinds of vegetables by the kilo, kilos of beef, chicken, pork and fish which will allow her to make a variety of dishes. Moreover, with her earnings she will continue paying off her car and new gas stove. Matilde is a very enthusiastic and happy woman, she is 41 years old, and she would like to forge a better future and a peaceful old age, which is why she would like to have a grocery store in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Matilde pertenece al banco comunal Amor y Paz, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Desarrolla el negocio en un puesto de ventas del Mercado Privado Los Ángeles de esta ciudad, lugar donde diariamente acuden sus comensales, los cuales son moradores de la propia localidad o visitantes de lugares cercanos, Su experiencia como trabajadora del hogar le permitió aprender a cocinar y tener una buena sazón, razones suficientes que la motivaron a instalar su propio negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo MENU, el cual lo realiza con mucha satisfacción, además siente que su economía ha mejorado porque puede satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos. Con el préstamo de S/ 800.00, el cual pagará en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos, los cuales le permitirá preparar comida variada, además con las ganancias continuará pagando las letras de su motocarro y de su nueva cocina a gas. Matilde es una mujer entusiasta y alegre de 41 años, quien desea forjarse un futuro mejor y una vejez tranquila, por lo que anhela tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes en su propio hogar.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients (rice, sugar, stews, vegetables, etc)

Compra de insumos (arroz, azúcar, menestras, verduras, etc)

loans.name: Maya

texts.es:
Ms. May is a member of the Los Jazmines community bank, and she sells groceries and plastic bags from a stand in the Moyabamba market in the district and province of Moyamba in the department of San Martín. Born into a family of merchants, her interest in the business was sparked and, when she was older, she began selling fruit and vegetables and then moved to selling groceries and plastic bags from her stand at the Moyabamba market. She was thus able to raise her 6 children, all of whom are now living on their own. With a loan valued at 2,500.00 sols, to be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase a variety of groceries, such as boxes of soap, dishwashing detergent, several brands of bleach (marsella, bolivar, jumbo), etc., 50-kilogram sacks of rice, packaged toilet paper, canned fish, liters of oil, 20-packs of salt, packaged pasta and plastic bags of different sizes for different uses. She is 63 years old and lives with her husband. She has always stood out as a fighter, a hard worker, responsible and perseverant, and she would like to add plastic products to her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maya es socia del banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bolsas de plástico en el puesto de venta del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Moyabamba, distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Nacida en una familia de comerciantes, despertó en ella su apego al negocio, por lo que siendo ya mayor se inició vendiendo frutas y verduras para luego dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y bolsas de plástico en su puesto de venta del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Moyabamba, y de esa manera sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos que ahora son todos independientes. Con el crédito de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón, lava vajillas, lejía de diferentes marcas (marsella, bolivar, jumbo), etc., sacos de 50 kilogR. de azúcar, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, sal en paquetes de 20 bolsas, fideos en paquetes y bolsa de plástico de diferentes tamaños y para diferentes usos. Tiene 63 años y vive con su esposo. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora, responsable y perseverante, la cual anhela adicionar a su negocio la venta de productos de plástico.

loans.use:
Purchase of groceries (soap, sugar, oil, etc.) and plastic bags

Compra de abarrotes (jabón, azúcar, aceite, etc) y bolsas de plásticos

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia lives in the region of San Martín, in the province of Lamas, in the district of Lamas. Her business is located at 1746 Jr. San Martín. She cultivates and sells ornamental plants for the purpose of improving her economic situation and contributing to the beautification of the town. At first, she could not count on her husband’s support because he thought it was a waste of time and money to have a plant nursery. However, over time he came to realize that it is a productive business and now he helps her maintain the nursery.

With this loan, which she will pay back over a period of 6 months, she will buy seeds by the kilogram, new plant seedlings, ceramic planters of different sizes, and organic material so that she can offer quality plants for sale.

Otilia is 64 years old and she lives with her husband and her youngest daughter; they are the most important part of her life. Each year in December, a portion of the profits earned from the plant sales is used to organize a chocolatada (a holiday event where hot chocolate and small gifts are given to poor children) for the poor children of Lamas, so as to give back the blessings received during the year.

Otilia’s dream is to improve her nursery and to offer a variety of plant species for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Otilia vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Lamas. El negocio está ubicado en el Jr. San Martín 1746 y se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de plantas ornamentales con la finalidad de mejorar su situación económica y contribuir con el ornato de la localidad. Al principio no contaba con el apoyo de su esposo puesto que él consideraba que era una pérdida de tiempo y dinero el dedicarse al cuidado de un vivero, pero con el tiempo fue dándose cuenta que es un negocio productivo y hoy en día la apoya con el mantenimiento del vivero.

Con este préstamo, el cual pagará en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará semillas en kilogramos, plantones de nuevas plantas, vasijas de barro de diferentes tamaños y materia orgánica para ofrecer plantas de calidad.

La señora Otilia tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo e hija menor quienes son el motor de su vida. Una parte de las ganancias obtenidas de las ventas de plantas en cada año se utiliza para la organización de una chocolatada en el mes de diciembre para los niños pobres de la localidad de Lamas y devolver de esa manera las bendiciones recibidas durante el año.

Su sueño es implementar mejor su vivero y ofrecer plantas de las variadas especies.

loans.use: To buy seeds, ceramic planters, organic material, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Amelia belongs to the “Bold Women” Comunal Bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Moyabamba. She displays her business in a kiosk located in the “Tioyacy” parking lot, where she services the interior towns of the province, because of this her clientele is pretty fluid and her sales are secured by her good deals and her good seasonings and cleanliness. She began selling grilled meats, but like a good businesswoman she saw that the sales of food from a menu were more profitable, because of this she decided to change her business partnering herself with a friend, and together they are furthering their families. With the loan of 2,000 soles, that which she will pay in one installment in 6 months, she will finish paying for the cooking gas that she bought, furthermore it will serve her to acquire the ingredients for the preparation of the food like rice, sugar, vegetables at wholesale, beef, chicken, pork and fish, also in kilograms, that will allow her to prepare various food for her clients. Rosa Amelia is a young woman of 38 years, peaceful, enthusiastic and persevering who desires a better future for her children and has dreams of constructing her own house and insuring a roof over their heads and to give them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Amelia pertenece al banco comunal ” Mujeres Audaces”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Desarrolla su negocio en un kiosco ubicado en el paradero de autos “Tioyacu”, el cual realiza servicio a los pueblos del interior de la provincia, por lo que la clientela es bastante fluida y sus ventas están aseguradas dado su buen trato y su buena sazón y limpieza. Se inició vendiendo parrillas de carne de pollo, pero como buena negociante vio que era más rentable la venta de comida tipo menú, por lo que decidió cambiar de negocio asociándose con una amiga, juntas están sacando adelante a sus familias. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, el cual pagará en un plazo de 6 meses, terminará de pagar la cocina a gas que compró, además le servirá para adquirir los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilogramos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado, también en kilogramos, que le permitirá preparar comida variada a sus clientes. Rosa Amelia es una mujer joven de 38 años, tranquila, entusiasta y perseverante que desea un futuro mejor para sus hijos por lo que sueña con construir su propia casa y asegurarles un techo y darles una buena educación.

loans.use: Money for cooking and the purchase of ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Ysabela

texts.es:
Mrs. Isabel belongs to “The Jasmines” Comunal Bank, she lives in the San Martin region, in the province and region of Moyabamba. She has a beauty salon in her house where she dedicates herself to cutting and dying the hair of women, men and children, at the same time she offers services such as manicures, pedicures and sells beauty products, an activity that suits her well because her work is well known in the city. With the loan of 1,000 soles, which she will pay off in 6 months, she will buy materials that she will use daily such as dyes in different colors and nail polishes in different tints, at the same time part of the money she will invest in the marketing of her business. Mrs. Isabel is 43 years old, she lives with her husband and her 3 children, she is a young, optimistic woman, she dreams of installing a Spa in her house that offers her clients integral attention to physical beauty

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba. Tiene un salón D. belleza en su propia casa en la que se dedica a cortar y teñir el cabello D. damas, caballeros y niños, asimismo da servicio D. manicura, pedicura y venD. productos D. belleza, actividad para la que esta capacitada, por lo que su trabajo es bien reconocida en la ciudad. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará materiales que utiliza diariamente como tintes en diferentes colores y marcas por docenas, shampoo, cremas para cuerpo y manos por docenas, esmaltes en diferentes tonos, asimismo parte del dinero lo invierte en publicidad para su negocio. La señora Isabel tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, mujer joven y optimista, anhela instalar también en su casa un SPA que ofrezca a su clientela una atención integral D. la belleza física.

loans.use: To purchase materials and pay for the advertising of her business

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde is 45 years old and lives with her partner, Francisco, who is 42 years old. Together they have 3 daughters who are still under Matilde’s care.

She has a well-stocked mini market that she operates from her home. She also makes and sells cigars (a type of handmade Cuban cigar made with dried tobacco leaves). Her partner works as a driver for a construction supply company.

She says that at first, only her partner worked, until she decided to open a mini market in order to help with the household expenses. Now she is satisfied with the fact that her business is thriving. She is requesting this loan in order to buy canned goods, soft drinks, fruit, noodles, sugar, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde tiene 45 años y vive en pareja con Francisco que tiene 42 años. De esta unión nacieron tres hijas que aún viven con ella.

Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida que funciona en su domicilio. Al mismo tiempo se dedica a la fabricación y venta de cigarros (una especie de habano hecho a mano de hojas secas de tabaco). Su pareja trabaja como chofer para una empresa de venta de materiales de construcción.

Cuenta que en un principio solamente su pareja trabajaba hasta que ella decidió abrir su despensa para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar. Hoy cuenta con satisfacción que le va muy bien en el negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos enlatados, gaseosas, frutas, fideos, azúcar, harina, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of canned goods, soft drinks, fruit, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. Beatriz belongs to the “Nuestro Senor de Martha” Comunal Bank. She dedicates herself to the sale of clothes of all qualities in the back alley of “Huaylas,” Huaraz district, Huaraz province, Ancash region. Beatriz makes the most of the patron saint festivals in the different districts of the region in order to sell her products. With this loan of 1,700.00 soles, which she will pay back in 8 installments, she will buy 2 dozen wool pants, 2 dozen ensembles of cotton for children, 2 dozen wool sweaters for women and men, 3 dozen shirts and 3 dozen jackets for women and men. Beatriz is married and doesn’t have any children (the past year she was expecting but she miscarried.) Her husband is a driver and owner of a truck. Both are saving for their future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Beatriz pertenece al banco comunal Nuestro Señor de Martha. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de toda calidad en el callejón de Huaylas, distrito Huaraz, provincia Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Beatriz aprovecha las fiestas patronales en los diferentes distritos de la región para vender sus productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 8 cuotas comprará 2 docenas de pantalones de lana, 2 docenas de conjunto de algodón para niñas y niños, 2 docenas de chompas de lana para damas y caballeros, 3 docenas de poleras y 3 docenas de casacas para damas y caballeros. Beatriz es casada y no tiene hijos (el año pasado estuvo esperando un bebe y al nacer falleció). Su esposo es chofer y dueño de una camioneta tipo combi. Ambos están ahorrando para el futuro.

loans.use: To purchase clothes (wool pants, sweaters, jackets, etc.)

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, who is 29 years of age, has been living with her partner José—who is 31 years old—for many years. Together they have two daughters who are 10 and 9 years old and attend elementary school.

Her partner works in an automotive repair shop in the capital city of Asunción. Norma is a hairstylist. She says that because of her humble beginnings, she was unable to attend college, so she decided to study cosmetology. She has been working in this field for 7 years.

She comments that she started off as an assistant in a beauty salon, until she was able to save enough money to set up her own beauty salon. Her greatest dream is to buy her own home and open a bigger salon there, since she cannot currently do so because she is renting her house.

Norma is requesting this loan in order to buy beauty supplies for her salon. She vows to repay her loan punctually every month.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma tiene 29 años, vive en pareja desde hace muchos años con José que tiene 31 años. De dicha unión nacieron dos hijas que actualmente tienen 10 y 9 años respectivamente. Ambas aún van a la escuela primaria.

Su pareja trabaja en un taller mecánico situado en Asunción, capital del país. Norma es peluquera de profesión. Comenta que debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde tomó la decisión de estudiar dicho oficio ya que no pudo ir a la universidad y hace 7 años que trabaja en lo mismo.

Comenta que comenzó trabajando como ayudante de una peluquería hasta que logró ahorrar lo suficiente para montar su propio negocio. El mayor sueño de Norma es el de comprar una casa propia debido a que vive en una de alquiler para luego allí abrir una peluquería mas amplia.

Norma solicita el crédito para comprar insumos y productos para su peluquería y se compromete a pagarlos de forma puntual y mensual.

loans.use: Purchase of hair cream, conditioner, hair dye, brushes, hair rollers, curling irons, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristina belongs to the Warac Communal Bank. She has a tourist agency and provides services in the different tourist circuits of the region. Her agency is located in the Huaraz district, Huaraz province, Ancash region. With the loan of 2,000 soles, which will be paid in 6 installments, she will purchase 6 wheels for the passenger van that they possess. Cristina is 55 years old, she is married, she has 3 children that are studying at the upper level, her husband is a driver and both dedicate themselves to this business.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cristina pertenece al banco comunal Warac. Tiene una agencia de servicios de turismo y brinda servicios en los diferentes circuitos turísticos de la Región. Su agencia está ubicada en el distrito de Huaraz, provincia Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 cuotas, comprará 6 llantas para la camioneta tipo custer que posee. Cristina tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos que son estudiando de nivel superior, su esposo es chofer y ambos se dedican a este negocio.

loans.use: The purchase of tires for their passenger van.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana belongs to the San Martin of Porras Communal Bak. She dedicates herself to the decoration of cakes and buffets for every type of engagement. Her business is located in the Huaraz district, Huaraz province, Ancash region. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be paid in 6 installments, she will purchase fabric for tablecloths and funds for chairs. Juana is 50 years old, she is married, she has 3 children and her husband is a professor. Her husband as much as her children support her in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al banco comunal San Martín D. Porras. Se dedica a la elaboración D. tortas y buffets para todo tipo D. compromisos. El negocio está ubicado en el distrito D. Huaraz, provincia Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 cuotas, comprará 3 fardos D. tela para hacer manteles y fundas para las sillas. Juana tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es profesor. Tanto su esposo como sus hijos también la apoya en este negocio.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Luzmila Elida

texts.es:
Mrs. Luzmila belongs to the Señor de los Milagros de Chavin community bank. She owns a small store selling candy, refreshments and cookies. A year ago she installed a telephone booth from which she sells calling cards, chips, videos and CDs. The business is located in the Chavin de Huantar district of the Huari province in the department of Ancash. With a loan valued at 700.00 sols, to be repaid in four installments, she will purchase calling cards in 10, 20 and 30-sol denominations and 10 mobile phone chips. She will also purchase 10 variety packs of cookies for the store. Luzmila is 38 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is an electrician, and is temporarily employed. The income generated by the business allows her to support her husband and pay for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Luzmila pertenece al banco comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin. Tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de golosinas, gaseosa y galletas. Hace un año ha colocado un locutorio en el cual vende tarjetas telefónicas, chips, videos y CDs. El negocio está ubicado en el distrito de Chavin de Huantar, provincia de Huari, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará tarjetas telefónicas de S/. 10, 20 y 30 nuevos soles y 10 chips de telefonía móvil. También comprará 10 paquetes de galletas de diferente tipo para la tienda. Luzmila tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Su esposo es electricistas, el cual tiene trabajo eventual. El ingreso que genera con el negocio le permite apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use:
Purchase of phone cards and cookies.

Compra de tarjetas telefónicas y galletas

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela belongs to the communal bank San Martín de Porras and she dedicates herself to the sale of clothes and beauty supplies. She offers these to her relatives and friends during door-to-door visits. The business is located in her home, in the Huaraz district of the Ancash department.

With the loan of 1,200 soles (approximately $425USD), to be repaid in four monthly installments, she would buy childrens’ tops and pants, sweaters for men and women, and cosmetics.

Marcela is 33 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband is a public employee. Both help with their cost of living expenses and they are educating their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marcela pertenece al banco comunal San Martín de Porras, se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, los cuales ofrece a sus familiares y amigos mediante visitas domiciliarias. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el distrito de Huaraz, provincia Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 docenas de polos para niñas y niños, 2 docenas de chompas para damas y caballeros, una docena de pantalones para niños y niñas y una docena de estuches de cosméticos. Marcela tiene 33 años de edad, es casada con 2 hijos y su esposo es empleado público. Ambos colaboran con los gastos del hogar y están educando a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina belongs to the communal bank Señor de los Milagros de Chavin. She sells food (breakfast and lunch), an activity she started at 15 years of age when selling corn, eggs, and potato soup. Her business is located in the Chavin de Huantar district in the Ancash department.

With the loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350USD), to be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes and vegetables (such as beans, lentils and split peas).

Bernardina is 70 years old, a widow, and has 5 grown children who support their own homes. She, through her business, supports herself.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin. Se dedica a la venta de alimentos (desayuno y almuerzo). Esta actividad la inició a los 15 años de edad vendiendo choclo, huevo, papa sancochada y sopa de papa. Posteriormente amplió el negocio con la venta de desayuno (caldo de cabeza, caldo de gallina, etc.) y almuerzos (menú). El negocio está ubicado en el distrito de Chavin de Huantar, provincia de Huari, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 cuotas, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 baldes de aceite, 5 paquetes de fideos surtido, 1 saco de papa, 20 kilos de menestras (frijoles, lentejas y arvejas partidas). Bernardina tiene 70 años, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos que son independientes y que se dedican a solventar sus hogares y ella con ayuda del negocio se mantiene sola.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for cooking (sugar, oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Elieser Jose

texts.es:
Elieser José is originally from Bluefields, Nicarague. He's 33 years old and married to Carla Chavarria, and together they have two young children who are currently enrolled in elementary school. These expenses are paid for by income from selling basic grains and other items, which he has done for eight years. His target customers are farmers. Currently, he needs to purchase 5 units of wheat at $27 per unit, 10 units of peanuts at $30 per unit, and 2 units of corn at $32.50 a unit to meet his customers' demands, which has grown in recent months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Elieser José J. F. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefielfds, tiene 33 años de edad esta casado con la Sr. Carla Chavarria ambos tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios primarios estos gastos son pagados con el ingreso de la venta de granos básicos. El Sr. J. tiene mas de 8 años de experiencia sus clientes potenciales son granjeros. En estos momentos necesita comprar 5 quintales de trigo a $ 27.00 dólares el quintal, 10 quintales de Payana a $ 30.00 dólares el quintal y 2 quintales de maíz amarillo a $32.50 dólares el quintal para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que a aumentado en estos últimos meses.

loans.use: Purchase five units of wheat, 10 of peanuts and two of corn.

loans.name: Belmira

texts.en:
Belmira M. V. has a business raising and selling chickens in the city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She started the business 6 months ago from the back of her home with the help of Manuela Ramos Credi Mujer´s chicken raising project.  They taught her how to raise and care for the chickens including what medicines are necessary and helped her design a modern chicken coup.  She now has a hundred valuable chickens to sell and a steady source of income for many years to come.

Belmira is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She´s an active, happy woman and now the president of Manuela Ramos´s chicken project.  She helps educates other women partnered with the Microfinance Institution start their own profitable chicken businesses.  She loves helping, building relationships, and being a positive member in her community.  Before she worked in Lima as a house maid for many years.

Belmira is a member of the community bank Mi Sueño and is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over 4 months.  With the loan she will buy food and medicines for her poultry.  One day she dreams of owning some land where she can raise other animals as well.

loans.use: To buy food and medicines for her poultry

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria I. T. has a general store outside of Juanjui, San Martin.  She supplies the neighborhood of Juanjui Parte Alta with their everyday products so they don’t need to make the journey into the center of town.  She has had the store for three years and it has grown rapidly.  She says much of her success has been the result of strategy and creativity.  She is always friendly, attentive, organized, and charismatic.  She also attracts clients by providing store credit and holiday raffles.  

Cesaria is 34 years old, happily married, and has two daughters.  Family is extremely important to her so she loves working from home where she can spend time with her children.  She is very happy right now because she has been able to take charge of her own life and help her family economically.  Cesaria looks forward to sending her children to University or a technical school.  She is also happy with all the new friends she’s made.

Cesaria is a member of the community bank Eden Celestial and is requesting a loan of $700 to repay over six months.  With the loan she would like to restock and add medicines to sell.  She looks forward to being able to provide a better service and grow her business.

loans.use: To restock and add medicines to sell

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta P. T. runs a general store in the city of Jaunjiucillio, San Martin.  She started the store ten years ago after spending the majority of her life selling goods at the main market in downtown Juanjiu.  Enriqueta was tired of traveling and working for minimal wages.  Her store has grown annually and she has many loyal customers.  She provides daily, weekly, and monthly credit to trusted clients.  The people of Jaunjuicillio are also happy to use Enriqueta’s store instead of making the long trip to the main market.

Enriqueta is 62 years old, married, and has six children.  She is happy with her business, the independence she’s gained, and all of the friends she has made.  She is happy to serve her community and help her family.  Education is important and she is looking forward to helping fund her grand children’s University bills.

A member of the community bank Eden Celestial, Enriqueta is requesting a loan of $1,025 to repay over 6 months.  With the loan she would like to restock and add new products like underwear, and school uniforms.  The children of Juanjuicillo return to school soon.

loans.use: To restock and add new products like underwear and school uniforms.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana R. B. is an ambitious business woman in the jungle city of Bellavista, San Martin.  Juana has a store built into her home where she sells fish native to the region.  Her family also has a business raising these native fish in a pond they own outside of the city.

Juana is happily married and has three young children.  She works very hard and organizes her time wisely so she can care for her children, home, and business.  Her children are of the highest priority, it is very important that they have the opportunity to be who they would like to be.  She manages the family's money and saves for their future.  She loves her business because it lets her work from home where she can also spend time with her family.  

A member of the community bank Virgen de la Puerta, Juana is requesting a loan of  $1025 to repay over six months.  With the loan she would like to buy a variety of fish from the coast as well as dried fish to sell at her store.  One day Juana would like to have a store stocked with all types of fish and seafood.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fish

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita R. R. has a business selling fish in the jungle city of Bellavista, San Martin.  She has managed the business with her husband for over 12 years.  Her husband is a master fisherman and he catches the fish every morning while Juanita then sells the fish from her home and in the town's main market.  She has many loyal customers because her fish are always the freshest at the market.  Juanita has a lifetime of experience selling fish; her father had a similar business so she rarely runs into a problem she hasn’t seen before.

Juanita is 42 years old and has 5 children.  Neither Juanita nor her husband had the opportunity to study and become professionals.  Sending their children to University is of the highest importance to them.  Juanita loves her business because she can wake up early, work hard until the early afternoon and then have the rest of the day to spend with her children.

Juanita is a member of the community bank Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe and is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over six months.  With the loan she would like to buy new fishing nets, inner tubes, and some fish from the coast of Peru.  The investment will make her business more competitive.

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets, inner tubes and some fish from the coast

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila S. G. has a business manufacturing and selling brooms in the city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She runs the business with her husband and children.  She started the business in 2001 and now has clients all over the province.  They sell the brooms to individuals, general store, and in larger markets.  Although they had many challenges to overcome due to lack of experience and connections, Leila´s business now makes a sustainable profit.

Leila is 41 years old, married, and has 6 children.  She started the business to help her family gain independence from a life of working out in the fields.  Family is the driving force in her life, nothing would make her happier than to see all of her children attend a university or technical school.

Leila is a member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas and is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over the next four months.  With the loan Micaela will buy all of the materials necessary to manufacture the brooms.  The extra capital will help them meet increased demand.

loans.use: To buy materials to manufacture brooms

loans.name: Libbis

texts.en:
Libbis E. L. has a business manufacturing and selling bed spreads in the city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She started the business one year ago with $50 and her sewing machine.  Libbis had a lifetime of business experience but never a business of her own.  She sells her handmade bed spreads in the main market of Juanjui and door to door in the surrounding rural towns.  

The business has given her a new lease on life.  She is 48, married, has 3 children and happier than ever.  She has gained confidence, independence, and a voice in her community.  She has made many new friends and is more well known in the different communities.  Her children have more opportunities and live in a healthier environment.  Now the entire family dreams of a better life.

Libbis is a member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas and is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to buy thread and materials of many different patterns and colors.

loans.use: To buy thread and materials of many different patterns and colors

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.en:
Lina Maria R. Carlos is an experienced bread maker.  She’s been making bread in the city of Juanjui for the majority of her life.  Her father had a similar business were she learned the secrets of how to make the tastiest bread in Juanjui.  Lina sells her bread allover the province of Mariscal Casceres to loyal customers.  She says her secret is friendly, punctual service and the use of the highest quality, natural ingredients.  

Lina is 77 years old and a widow.  She has five full grown children and a gaggle of grandchildren.  All of her family helps run the business now that her husband has past away.  Keeping the business healthy so she can take care and educate her family is very important to Lina.  Lina is also proud to have a business that pays taxes to the municipality of Jaunjui.

Lina is a member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas and is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over four months.  With the loan she would like to buy ingredients for her bread such as grains, butter, and eggs.  The extra capital will help her meet the demand of her clients.  In the future Lina would like to buy an electrical oven to cook her breads.

loans.use: To buy ingredients (grains, butter and eggs)

loans.name: Lourdes Mercedes

texts.en:
Lourdes Mercedes R. M. has a store where she sells food and drinks in the center of Juanjui, San Martin.  She’s rented the space for her business since 1996.  She has a good location next to a small technical university where students come to grab a quick bite to eat, drink, and relax.  She is established in the city and now has many loyal customers.

Lourdes is 45 years old, single and has one child.  Her daughter is very important to her so she saves carefully so she can send her to University.  Lourdes started her business after working in restaurants for many years earning very little money.  She decided she could start her own business and take charge of her life.  She now feels happier and more confident than ever.

A member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas, Lourdes is seeking a loan of $275 to invest in her business.  She will repay the loan over a period of 4 months.  With the loan she would like to buy beer, sodas, and snack foods.  The loan will help her meet the demands of her clients.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas and snacks foods

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Mr Rolando lives with his family in the Santo Domingo neighborhood in Managua. He is a merchant who has a grocery store in his house. He runs this business along with his wife. She is a housekeeper and also dedicates herself to the care of their children. Mr Rolando asks for a loan to purchase basic grains and perishable goods for his business. This will allow him to support his children's education. Mr Rolando is a very venturous man. In two years he has built his business and little by little has increased the variety and quantity of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Rolando habita junto a su familia en el Barrio Santo Domingo de Managua. Es un comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, negocio que lleva adelante día a día con su esposa, ella es ama de casa y se dedica también al cuido de sus hijos. Don Rolando necesita el crédito para comprar granos básicos y productos perecederos para su hogar, ya que por la época escolar necesita dinero para poder brindarles a sus dos pequeños educación. Don Rolando es un hombre muy emprendedor en 2 años ha podido llevar adelante este negocio y hacerlo crecer cada vez un poco más en variedad y cantidad de productos.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and perishable goods

loans.name: Luce Angelica

texts.en:
Luce Angelica I. G. has a shop in the central market of Juanjui, San Martin.  At the shop she sells videos and DVDs that she buys directly from Lima.  She started the business 6 months ago after years of selling clothes with her mother.  The transition to video sales was smooth.  

Luce is 20 years old, single, and has a baby.  Her baby was the motivation for her to start her own business.  She wanted to do something empowering and gain independence.  She now has a steady income and is more optimistic about her families future.  Nothing would make her happier than to be able to send her child to University.

A member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas, Luce is requesting a loan of $175 to repay over the next four months.  With the extra capital she will buy new movies that aren’t already in stock.

loans.use: To buy new movies

loans.name: Yajaira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms Yajaira is a 34-year-old single mother of 3 children, ages 17, 16 and 6. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in Managua. She works all day in order to support her family. Ms Yajaira receives financial help from her ex-husband. However, she needs a greater income for her family. For this reason she has started a street-vending business selling clothes and shoes. Ms Yajaira sells her merchandise to neighbors and at the Santo Tomas municipality where she has various clients. Yajaira asks for a loan to purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics for her business. At the moment she has insufficient merchandise to display and sell to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Yajaira es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 17, 16 y 6 años, tiene 34 años y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua, trabaja todo el día para poder mantener a su familia. Doña Yajaira recibe ayuda económica de su ex marido, pero necesitaba un ingreso más para su familia. Es por eso que incursionó en el negocio de la venta de ropa y zapatos ambulantes. Doña Yajaira coloca su mercadería entre sus vecinos y también se traslada al municipio de Santo Tomás donde también tiene varios clientes. Yajaira necesita el crédito para comprar ropa, zapatos y cosméticos para su negocio, ya que actualmente no dispone de mucha de esta mercadería para poder colocarla.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel B. R. has a general store in the neighborhood of Juanjuicillo outside the jungle city of Juanjui, San Martin.  From the rented space Maribel sells goods that the population of Juanjuicillo most commonly purchases.  She started the store one year ago with $100 dollars and has experienced steady growth.  The store is also a comfortable environment where men come to drink beer.

Maribel is 29 years old, single, and has two children.  She initially started the business to help pay for her children’s education as well as take charge of her own.  It is often difficult for her to take care of her two young children and business but she works hard, organizes wisely, and receives help from her parents.  One day she dreams of owning a little home and sending her children to University.

Maribel is a member of the community bank, Maria Magdalena and is requesting a loan of $275 to repay over four months.  With the loan she would like to buy beer, soda, rice, oil, and restock her shelves.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda, rice, oil.

loans.name: Jesús Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jesús del Carmen O. is a woman who has dedicated a large portion of her life to working. Her business consists of selling fruits and corn-based drinks in small quantities. She is a single mother with four daughters under 15 years old, and she needs to provide for them during their scholastic years. She also sells clothing in small quantities during times of need, with the sole goal of maintaining the family nucleus.

She started her business 22 years ago. Of course, with the birth of her four daughters and being a single mother she looked for other business opportunities to help with their expenses. It's for this reason she decided to purchase her produce and then market them to her customers and later do the same with a small volume of clothes.

Kiva partner Ceprodel has helped her invest in her business with a total of 16 loans, which she has used to purchase products to sell. He goal is to reach higher sales levels and be one of the best merchants in León.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Jesús del Carmen O. es una dama que gran parte de su vida la ha dedicado al trabajo. Su negocio consta de venta de frutas y refresco a base de maíz (refresco de chicha) pero en menores cantidades. Es madre soltera con cuatro hijas menores de 15 años por lo que es su deber buscar la manera de suplir las necesidades de cada una de ellas por estar en la etapa escolar. También se ha dedicado en determinados momentos a vender ropa pero en menores cantidades con el único propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar.

Su negocio lo inicia hace 22 años, sin embargo con el nacimiento de sus cuatro hijas y al ser madre soltera busca la manera de obtener otro negocio que le ayude con los gastos de sus pequeñas. Es por esto que decide Invertir para la compra de sus productos para luego comercializarlos y además invierte en la compra de mínimos volúmenes de ropa para ofrecerlo a los clientes.

Ceprodel ha sido su ayuda ya que le ha brindado un total de 16 créditos que los ha invertido en la compra de sus productos para comercializarlos. Su meta es alcanzar mayores niveles de ventas y ser una de las mejores comerciantes en el departamento de León.

loans.use: Purchase products to increase inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. R. has a business selling jewelry, watches, and lingerie in the neighborhood of Juanjuicillio outside the jungle city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She started the business one year ago so she could help take charge of her life and gain some independence from her family. She sells her products door to door which can be difficult but she enjoys the challenge. Mary is charismatic, ambitious, and always treats her clients with the best service. She gets her goods directly from Lima so she can offer a cheaper price and has a weekly credit payment option for her clients.

Mary is twenty five years old, single, and doesn’t have any children.  Mary lives with her mother and works, saves, and dreams of a better life.  She is currently building her business and saving money so she can return to school to study Environmental Policy in Lima.  She is much happier because she has more friends and a voice in the community.

A member of the community bank Maria Magdelena, Mary is requesting a loan of $250 to repay over the next four months.  With the loan she would like to buy lingerie of different sizes and colors.

loans.use: To buy lingerie of different sizes and colors

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fatima A. is 28 years old. She is single with an 8-year-old child. Fatima works in the foreign trade zone in the city of Managua. Her workday begins at 6 a.m. and lasts until 8 p.m. Her cosmetics business along with the help she receives from the father of her child helps Fatima provide for her family. She lives with her parents who are elderly and who help her with the care of her child. Fatima solicits a loan for the insulation of the walls of her home which are made of zinc and cement. She needs to purchase plycem boards and wood for this alteration.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Fátima A. tiene 28 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo de 8 años. Fatima Trabaja como operaria en una Zona Franca de la ciudad de Managua, el día de Trabajo de Fátima está comprendido desde las 6.00 am hasta las 8.00 pm., es de ahí, de la venta de cosméticos y de la ayuda que recibe del padre del niño como Fátima alimenta a su familia. Vive con sus padres que ya son ancianos y quienes son los que la ayudan con el cuido de su pequeño hijo. Fátima solicita el crédito para forrar las paredes de su cuarto de habitación que actulamente son de zinc y cemento. Necesita comprar láminas de plycem y madera para poder hacer este cambio.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the insulation of her home

loans.name: Claudia Lucia

texts.es:
Claudia Lucia has dedicated herself to selling cheese at a post in the station market of León for the past two years. She used to sell her product while roaming but didn't have as good of sales because she wasn't in a fixed place, which she eventually acquired on her own initiative.

Claudia has four small children whom she has to care for, educate and feed under a strong roof. They have been her biggest inspiration for her work, and despite the lack of economic resources she has not lost hope that her business will help them make headway and successfully prepare her children for adulthood.

For this reason, Claudia is requesting a loan to help her increase her supplies by allowing her to purchase more ingredients to make cheese and thus be able to sell more. She hopes to continue receiving these beneficial loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Claudia Lucia se dedica a la actividad de venta de queso desde hace dos años e inicia esta actividad en un tramo en el mercado la Estación en León. Por iniciativa propia, antes de tener su tramo en el mercado se dedicaba de igual manera a vender queso pero lo hacia ambulantemente, sin embargo, no obtenía beneficios por no estar en un local fijo.

Claudia es madre de 4 pequeños a los que tiene el deber de cuidar, educar, alimentar y brindarles un techo digno. Su mayor inspiración para trabajar han sido ellos, y a pesar de la escasez de recursos económicos que atraviesa en su hogar, no pierde las esperanzas de que su negocio saldrá adelante y sus hijos serán personas preparadas.

Por este motivo, solicitó un préstamo en Ceprodel el cual al ser otorgado le benefició en el sentido de que surtió más sus productos en la compra de mayor cantidad de queso para comercializarlo. Según comenta, continuará con estos beneficiosos créditos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Rosario Segunda

texts.en:
Rosario Segunda G. D. A. has a general store in the neighborhood of Juanjuicillo, outsiD. the main city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She started the store three years ago in a front space of her home selling commonly used goods.  She has now expanded the business to incluD. the sale of specialty goods like picture frames, school supplies, clothing, and perfume.  Loyal customers are happy they don’t need to walk into Juanjui to buy these goods and have access to store credit. 

Rosario is forty seven years old, married, and has three children.  She started the shop because she was sick of working out in the fields away from her family.  She is happy she maD. the leap because now she earns more and has more friends.  Her children are very important to her and she saves to send them to University.

A member of the community bank Maria Magdalena, Rosario is requesting a $625 loan to repay in 4 months.  With the loan she would like to buy school uniforms, rice, beer, oil, and stuffed animals.

loans.use: To buy uniforms, rice, beer, oil, and stuffed animals

loans.name: Seudimia

texts.en:
Seudimia C. S. has a business selling fish in the city of Bellavista, San Martin.  She sells her fish in the main market of Bellavista at a stall she rents.  Seudimia wakes up early everyday to sell talapia, boa, and gamitama.  She has been selling fish for 7 years so she has many faithful customers and knows exactly what they like.

Seudimia is a widow and has 3 children.  Two of her children are grown but she is still working hard to save money and send her youngest to a university.  She wants all of her children to have more opportunities to advance in life than she did. 

A member of the community bank Nuesta Senora de Guadelupe, Seudimia is requesting a $350 loan that she will repay over six months.  With the loan she will be able to increase the variety and quality of fish she sells.

loans.use: To inventory her inventory of fish

loans.name: Paula Luz

texts.es:
The life of Paula C. has been full of struggles and difficult situations. Currently she sells all types of homemade products and cosmetics, but she started with a different occupation. She began by selling medications in the street . She sold medication for several years until the practice was prohibited and all of her products were taken from her.

Since she was a single mother responsible for two children, she decided to invest what little savings she had into the purchase of various products and began selling them from her home. She now has 30 years of experience selling homemade products and cosmetics. This is how she has moved forward tending and developing her business. Recently she began obtaining credits from CEPRODEL (she has received 13 up till now) which she has used for her families’ benefit by purchasing more merchandise and bettering the conditions of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La vida que ha llevado la señora Paula C. ha sido de muchos esfuerzos y además de muchas situaciones duras. Su negocio actualmente es la venta de todo tipo de productos caseros y personales(cosmeticos), pero para poder haber llegado hasta aquí comenzó primeramente con la venta de medicamentos donde se dedicó por varios años a este negocio vendiendo ambulante hasta que en una ocasión se prohibió la venta de estos productos y le fueron desposeídos.

Por ser madre soltera pero responsable con sus dos hijos decide invertir todos sus pocos ahorros para la compra de productos varios y comenzarlos a vender poco a poco en su hogar (Actualmente tiene 30 años de vender productos caseros y personales). Así es como ha venido creciendo y desarrollándose hasta que obtuvo créditos en CEPRODEL (Actualmente un total de 13 créditos) que le han beneficiado para la compra de mercadería y además para mejorar en parte las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic supplies.

loans.name: Simona

texts.en:
Simona Santamaría B. has a store selling clothes in the jungle city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She rents a space in the main market where customers from all over the Province come to shop.  Simona started the shop three years ago with the help of her parents who live in another city.  She now runs the shop by herself and has built relationships with many loyal customers.  

Simona is 21 years old, single, and has a son.  Although she would have preferred to study and become a professional she feels lucky that she has her shop and doesn’t need to rely on anyone.  She likes business, building relationships, and having a voice in her community.  One day she dreams of owning a home and educating her child.

A member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas, Simona is requesting a $525 loan to repay over four months.  With the loan she would like to buy jeans of all types and styles from a distributor in Lima.  She has wanted to add jeans to her stock since creating the business.

loans.use: To buy jeans of all types and styles.

loans.name: Virginia Adilia

texts.es:
Virginia sells vegetables in the “Station” market of Leon. She began her small business 12 years ago. At the time she sold small quantities which at times she was unable to sell due to low demand or the high level of competition in the market.

In order to maintain her nuclear family Virginia applied for loans from Ceprodel. She obtained 16 loans which she used to purchase additional vegetables and also to cover the expenses of her family, such as electricity, water and school tuition for her young children.

Virginia’s great dream is to be able to save for the future of her children by becoming a large merchant in the “Station” market and thus being able to impact the entire population of shoppers.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Virginia es a la venta de verduras en el mercado la Estación en León. Su pequeño negocio inició hace 12 años con la venta de pequeñas cantidades de verduras que en ocasione ni siquiera eran vendidas ya que ofertaba poco y además era mucha la competencia en su alrededor.
