Consiente de la necesidad de mantener su núcleo familiar, la señora Virginia ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel obteniendo un total de 16 créditos que le han favorecido en la adquisición de los perecederos (las verduras) y también en los gastos de su humilde hogar como en el pago de la energía eléctrica, agua y la educación de sus pequeños. Su mayor sueño es llegar a ser una gran comerciante en el mercado la Estación y llegar a impactar toda la masa de compradores de dicho mercado con el único propósito de ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: Investment in business: Sale of Vegetables

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Julia Mercedes is a single mother with two children still living at home. She sells sandals, slippers, children’s clothing and wrapping paper in the “Station” market in the state of Leon. She began selling these type of items 21 years ago as a street vendor. Since then, due to the fatigue associated with selling in the streets under the hot sun, she decided to apply for her own space within the market. When she obtained a stall within the market, she was faced with the new need to fully stock the fixed location.

Through the years and the help she received from Ceprodel, she has been able to more fully stock her store and obtain better returns than before she instituted her business inside the market. It is necessary to emphasize that up till now Julia has received 29 small loans, all of which she has paid on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Julia Mercedes es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su responsabilidad. Tiene ubicado su negocio de venta de sandalias, chinelas, ropa de niño y papeles de regalo en el mercado la Estación del departamento de León. Su actividad comienza hace 21 años cuando vendía ambulante estos productos por las calles de León. Sin embargo, debido a la fatiga de vender en las calles por la exposición al sol, decide solicitar su propio puesto en el interior del mercado. Al obtener el puesto se le presenta una nueva necesidad que es el surtir de productos su negocio ya que con lo que vendía ambulante era muy poco para surtir su negocio en su nuevo local.

A través de los años y con la ayuda que le ha brindado Ceprodel ha logrado surtir mas su negocio obteniendo mejores utilidades en comparación a las que percibía antes de tener su local. Es necesario destacar que hasta este momento la señora Julia ha realizado un total de 29 créditos pagados satisfactoriamente en tiempo y forma.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (sandals, slippers, and children's clothing).

loans.name: Maxima's Group

texts.en:
Maxima, Simeona, and Lucia have been members of the community bank “Arco Iris II” for 10 years. During that time, they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and how to better care for their health. They enjoy attending bank meetings and are able to forget the problems they have at home.

Maxima is 41 years old and has two children who are 21 and 17. Fifteen years ago, Maxima moved from the country to the city of Ayacucho and began to sell garlic and cheese in the market. With her profits she has been able to put a roof on her house.

Lucia is 41 years old and has three children who are 21, 17, and15. For five years she has been traveling to surrounding markets to buy cheese, which she sells from her house in Ayacuchol.

Simeona moved from Lima to Ayacucho ten years ago and did not have anything. A friend recommended that she join the community bank. She started a business selling grains, cheese, and vegetables, which she buys in the country and sells to set clients in the city. With the profits she has been able to buy more and more land where she grows some of her vegetables.

They need loans of 1000, 400, and 1600 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying cheese, vegetables, and other items. Through the community bank, they have learned to save. They will use their savings to buy land, pay for medical care, and put a roof on their houses. Maxima, Simeona, and Lucia dream of owning a farm where they can raise cows, cattle and guinea pigs, (which are considered a delicacy in Peru). They also wish to expand their businesses and that theie children can have a better life.

loans.use: to invested in buying cheese and vegetables

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria De Jesús A. sells juices and clothing in “Lion’s Station” market. She is a highly talented woman, who can make juices of all kinds. Since she was small, she exhibited skill in the kitchen and especial skill blending and mixing natural fruit juices. She is a single mother with one young child. She bears the full responsibility of caring for this child since it is so young.

Maria is applying for a spot inside the “Station” market, which will soon be confirmed. In order to better her equipment Maria has received 6 previous loans from Ceprodel. These she invested in remodeling her current location and also to support her fruit juice and clothing sales.

Both of industries, fruit juice and clothing sales, are very competitive. There are numerous other individuals that sell juice and clothing in the same market.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Maria de Jesús A. se dedica a la venta de refrescos y también a la venta de ropa en el mercado la Estación de León. Es una dama con un alto talento para la elaboración de refrescos de todo tipo. Desde muy pequeña se ha caracterizado por ser excelente cocinera y en especial una excelente elaboradora de refrescos naturales. Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo al que tiene la responsabilidad de apoyarlo en todas sus necesidades por ser menor de edad.

Solicitó un local en el mercado la Estación, el cual al poco tiempo le fue confirmado, sin embargo, para mejorar las condiciones de su infraestructura ha realizado un total de 6 créditos en Ceprodel que los ha invertido en la remodelación de su localidad, además le han servido para continuar con la venta de refrescos y la venta de la ropa que es un negocio muy competitivo por el hecho de que en el mercado donde ella se ubica se pueden encontrar fácilmente otras personas que venden refrescos y de igual manera otras personas que venden todo tipo de ropa.

loans.use: Purchase of top of the line ingredients for the production of juices.

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en:
Rayda, Dina, and Claudia have been members of the community bank “Arco Iris II.” Through their bank, they have learned about customer service, saving, and financial literacy. They feel that the other members are like sisters.

Rayda is 31 years old and has three children, who are ages 16, 12, and 7. For the past five years she has been traveling to different communities around Ayacucho to buy grains, which she then sells in a market in Ayacucho. She was able to start this business after receiving a loan from the community bank. The business enables her to provide for her children.

Dina is 35 and has three children. They are 12, 11, and 7 years old. She is an artisan weaver. She learned how to weave from her husband and they now run the business together.

Likewise, Claudia also has three children. She is 38 years old. For the past 13 years she has been selling fruit in a market in Ayacucho. With her new loan, she will expand her business and begin to sell prepared meals.

Rayda, Dina, and Claudia need loans of 400, 1000, and 1000 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying grains (such as wheat and cornmeal), thread, and groceries (such as meat, potatoes, and oil) to make meals. A large part of participating in the community bank learning how to save. The women are encouraged to keep a savings account at the bank. With their savings, these women plan to improve their homes and pay for their children’s education. Rayda, Dina, and Claudia dream that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: to invest in buying grains (such as wheat and cornmeal), thread, and groceries (including meat, potatoes, and oil) to make meals

loans.name: Graciela's Group

texts.en:
Graciela and Hilda have both been members of the community bank “Arco Iris II” for about a year. Graciela was invited to join the bank by a friend and Hilda was invited by her mother. Through the community bank's activities, they have learned to be responsible and punctual. They have also learned about self-esteem and working together.

Graciela is 43 years old and has six children ranging from 2 to 22 years old. She is an artisan weaver. She learned the art from her husband 15 years ago and now runs her own business.

Hilda is 24 and has one daughter. She is also a weaver and runs her business with her husband. In the past, she owned a grocery store but was not able to make a profit.

They need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in thread, dyes, and other supplies needed for weaving. The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving. Graciela and Hilda both say that they are saving for emergency purposes. They are very happy with their accounts in the community bank because it would be impossible to save money otherwise. They joined the community bank to try and give their children better lives and that is why they continue to fight. Their dream is for their children to progress in life and have jobs as professionals.

loans.use: to invest in thread, dyes, and other supplies needed for weaving

loans.name: Ambrosia's Group

texts.en:
Ambrosia, Tomasa, and Sabina are members of the community bank “Señor de Huanca.” Ambrosia is one of the founding members and started with $1 to her name. She has been working with the bank for 12 years. Tomasa and Sabina have both been members for 5 years. By participating in the bank's activities, they have learned discipline and punctuality, as well as how to save and care for their children.

Ambrosia is 44 years old and has three children. She sells emolliente, which is a traditional beverage made from herbs and served warm. She has had this business for 15 years. Before that she sold meat, washed laundry, and engaged in other income generation activities. However, she prefers focusing on only one business.

Tomasa is 49 years old and has four children. She also sells emolliente, but only in the afternoons. In the mornings she sells tuna, a regional fruit which comes from cactus, and alfalfa. She has been doing this for 25 years. With her profits, she has been able to buy a house.

Sabina is 50 years old and has two children who are 20 and 15. For 19 years she has been buying products such as bread and different grains in Ayacucho and selling them in surrounding markets. She also has a piece of land where she grows vegetables.

They need loans of 800, 2000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which they will invest in buying sugar, herbs, a rain cover for their stand, and seeds. The community bank teaches the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning account. They plan to use their savings to buy a house and help their children graduate from university. Their dream is to own their own house and land, to be able to pay for medical care, and that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: to invest in buying sugar, herbs, a rain cover for their stand, and seeds.

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Hilda, Agustina, and Maria are members of the community bank “Señor de Huanca”. Hilda has been a member for five years and Agustina and Maria for about one year. In that year they have learned how to be responsible, punctual, and hard working. They have also learned about friendship and how to work together like sisters.

Hilda is 37 years old and has two children, ages 14 and 11. For the past 10 years she has run a grocery store. Before that she sold propane. However, she did not enjoy it and was able to save enough to start her new business.

Agustina is 32 and has three children. Every Saturday and Sunday she travels to different markets in the region and buys grains which she sells in Ayacucho. She started this business six months ago with a loan from her community bank.

Maria is 39 years old and has 6 children ranging from 4 years old to 20. She also owns a grocery store. Before that she sold shish kabobs from a cart, but is able to make more money now.

They need loans of 1400, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively to buy things such as rice, sugar, milk, potatoes, and a small piece of land to grow vegetables. The community bank emphasizes saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Hilda, Agustina, and Maria are saving to pay for their children’s education, to improve their homes, and to buy a motorcycle. Their dreams are to own their homes, have land, and that their children can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, milk, potatoes, and a small piece of land to grow vegetables

loans.name: Tursunbek

texts.en:
Tursunbek is 35 years old and married with 4 children. His wife keeps house and looks after the kids.

Tursunbek farms a plot of land, which is the only source of income for his large family. He has been growing wheat and potatoes for 5 years now. The yield is sufficient for to feed his family and also generates enough for Tursunbek to support his family.

Today Tusunbek is requesting 1,000 Somoni (US$300) in order to purchase mineral fertilizers and potato seeds. The selling prices for the fertilizer and seeds today are lower than they’ll be in a month. This is Tursunbek's second loan. He has already shown himself to be a responsible client, and promises to repay the loan in 12 months

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Chahonbek

texts.en:
Chahonbek is a 37 year-old father of three. His wife keeps house and helps to and raise cattle.

Five years ago, Chahonbek obtained a plot of land. Since then, he has grown wheat and potatoes on his land. Chahonbek likes to work on the land. He believes if one works the land with love, the land feels this and pays back with rich yield. The spring is coming soon, and the hot season will start for Chahonbek. However, as any other farmer he is already preparing for this. Chahonbek wants to purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds.

To that end, Chahonbek is requesting 1000.00 Somoni (US$300) for a term of 12 months. This is Chahonbek's first loan and he is sure he shall be able to repay it in time.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Gavharoi

texts.en:
Y. Gavharoi is 49 years old and married with two children.

Gavharoi is full of energy. Although she is a seamstress now, she used to sell jewellery . Two years ago Gavharoi started her own business, tailoring and selling curtains. Gavharoi has very good taste and predicts well which styles and types of curtains can be of high demand. She is ready at any time to advise her clients in making their choice.

Gavhar has been working with IMON since April 2007. She manages all her loans accurately without violations and delinquencies. Today Gavharoi requests 1000.00 US Dollars. She is planning to expand her business and to open a private tailoring shop. Gavharoi thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business and open a private tailoring shop

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
R. Rano lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. Mrs. R. applied to MicroInvest in 2005 and since that time has been a client with business development loans. Her business stability and income permits her to return loans on time and to develop and improve her existing business. Mrs. R. is engaged in the business of selling children's, women's and men's underwear. She has a wide assortment and bulk buyers because the prices for her goods are lower than the regular bazaar price. She works directly with suppliers in Chinese factories.

Now Mrs. R. requests a loan of $450 to import new models.

loans.use: To import new models

loans.name: Munisa

texts.en:
K. Munisa is 25 years old and married with two wonderful children. Her daughter is 4 and her son is only 2 years old.

The difficult economical position of her family forced Munisa to start her own business. For two years, she has sold clothes for women in one of the local markets. Her husband assists her with her business.

Until now, Munisa has been renting her clothes store. Today she is requesting a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 12 months. Munisa wants to enlarge her turnover capital and to purchase her clothes store venue. Munisa has been provided with several loans by IMON and has shown herself to be a responsible client with good credit history.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and buy her own trading premises

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
D. Mahbuba lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. She started her business practically from scratch and now she has her own salon renting wedding gowns and providing appropriate services for weddings. The salon is located in a hotel building and has a good reputation, which is why it brings a tolerable business income.

Now Mrs. D. requests a loan of $725 for purchasing wedding accessories.

loans.use: for purchasing wedding accessories

loans.name: Ochaoi

texts.en:
Ochaoi is 48 years old. She and her husband - who works as a taxi driver- have raised 4 children.

Ochaoi is sells women's clothing such as knitted jackets, skirts and sweaters. She has been in this business already for 15 years. As a rule Ochaoi travels to Bishkek which is located in neighboring Kyrgyzstan, to purchase new goods. She tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices which allows her to retain her clientele.

Today Ochaoi requests 990.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. In February Ochaoi plans to take her next trip to Bishkek. She shall use the loan for purchasing new goods like knitted jackets, skirts and sweaters for women for selling. She promises to repay the loan in time and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods she sells by purchasing new knitted jackets, skirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en:
Zarofat has just turned 27 and is a single mother with one son.

Zarofat sells furniture and has been in this business for 3 years. She has become a real expert in furniture and knows all about the quality of various producers. Zarofat is polite with the clients and ready to offer furniture that can meet any taste and different levels of income. Her business is stable and generates enough income to support the needs of her family.

Today Zarofat requests 1000.00 US Dollars for a term of 12 months. Zarofat is planning to purchase new items of furniture for sale. Zarofat has shown herself to be a reliable client in repaying previous loans from IMON. Zarofat would like to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for sale

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: A. Shahnoza lives in Spitamen and is married with 2 children. She applied to MicroInvest for a business development loan in 2006 and since that time has been a repeat client of MicroInvest. She started her business selling small ware and now thanks to her previous loans has her own trade outlet in a wholesales bazaar, where she trades Delftwares (Delft pottery). She brings the goods by herself from China and that is why she trades in prices that are lower than regular bazaar prices. She has bulk buyers and a good assortment (vases, vessels, etc.). Now Mrs. A. requests a loan of $1200 for importing new goods.

loans.use: To import new goods

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: T. Manzura lives in the Nausky region and is married with 3 children. She is engaged in a commercial service and trade. She has her own shop selling Delftware (Delft pottery) that is located in one of the populous districts. Mrs.T. trades with prices that are lower than bazaar prices and she has a wide assortment (vases, vessels, etc.). She has repeat customers and a good business turnover. There are different departments in the shop (clothes department, children and infant wear department, and Delftware department). It permits her to return the taken loans on time and to develop the existing business. Now Mrs. T. requests a loan of $1200 to purchase new goods.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Khisrav

texts.en:
Khisrav is a 25-year old father of three children.

Four years ago Khisrav, obtained a plot of land on which he grows wheat and potatoes. This land is the only source of income for the family. Khisrav is a good farmer and manages to produce a reasonable yield and generate enough income to support not only his children and wife, but his parents as well.

Khisrav is requesting a loan of 3000.00 Somoni (US$875) for a term of 12 months. Khisrav believes it is better to get prepared for the spring hot season now. Thus, he is going to use the loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and potato seeds. As a client with good credit history, Khisrav assures everyone that he will repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is 49 years old. She and her husband have raised three children. Shahodat's husband is pictured as she was not well that day and her husband is assisting her in the business.

Shahodat sells oriental sleeves jackets and national dresses. In Tajikistan, it is a tradition about one week after a wedding party to invite the young couple and their closest relatives to visit the bride's parents. During this family occasion the bride is dressed in the beautiful national dress and oriental sleeves jacket with national hat. Shahodat has been in this business for 7 years. Her customers are happy with the goods and services she provides. Her business is the main source of income for her family and generates stable profit.

Today Shahodat requests a US$1,000 loan for a term of 6 months. She is planning to increase the range of goods she sells by purchasing new oriental sleeves jackets and national dresses for sale. Shahodat has received previous loans from IMON and proven herself a reliable client. She thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase new oriental sleeves jackets and national dresses for sale.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
M. Gulsara lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006 when she applied for a business development loan. It helped her to improve and develop her existing business and ultimately to return her loans.

Now Mrs. M. is engaged in the distribution of wholesale food products. She has 5 years of experience in the business and knows the business nuances that enable her to have a good business turnover. Now Mrs. M. requests a loan of $625 for the distribution of meat products.

loans.use: To distribute meat products

loans.name: Vazifa

texts.en: Vazifa is 38 years old and is a local resident of the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and four children. She breeds cattle in her yard together with her husband. They have had the business since 1997 and now are quite experienced. Vazifa raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. This is the family's only source of income. It can bring a good income. Vazifa wants to develop this business, to increase the number of cows. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock.

loans.use: To increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Lumiye

texts.en: Lumiya is 26 years old and a local resident of the town of Saatli. She is not married yet, and lives with her parents. She breeds cattle in her parents' yard together with her family. They have been engaged in this business for more than 4 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, and more and more people are getting into this business. Lumiya wants to develop the business, and increase the number of cows. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $500.

loans.use: To increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Total 2087(A) Group

texts.en:
Robinah is 35 years old married with four children. She owns a beauty salon. With the extra business profits she earns, she intends to buy a piece of land and build a house. Hajara has a charcoal selling business. Mary sells second-hand clothes. Bena has a retail shop. Teopista sells raw foods.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more salon items.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 47 years old, and is a local resident of the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She breeds cattle in her yard together with her husband. They have been engaged in this business since 1991 and are now quite experienced. Aida raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where there are no other jobs, and it can bring a good income. Aida wants to develop this business, to increase the number of calves by two.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Khamidkul

texts.en:
Khamidkul is 34 years old and married with 4 children.

Khamidkul owns and farms a plot of land. Having been trained by his father how to work the land, Khamidkul is quite a successful farmer. He grows wheat and potatoes, as well as breeds cattle. This provides his family with an efficient source of funding and helps improve their standard of living.

Today Khamidkul needs to prepare his land. Therefore, he is requesting 1,000 Somoni (US$300) to purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds for planting. Khamidkul thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of mineral fertilizer and seeds of potato

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: K. Nazira lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. She considers herself an executive and reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. Mrs. K. Nazira is engaged in the distribution of wholesale food products. She has 5 years of experience in the business. She has a good business turnover. Now Mrs. K. Nazira requests a loan of $625 for importing tinned food.

loans.use: To import tinned food

loans.name: Raset

texts.en: Raset is a 21-year-old local resident in the town of Saatli. He is not married yet, and lives with his parents. He breeds cattle in his parents' yard; they built a shed in the yard, and whole family is helping him. His mother is shown in the picture. He has engaged in this business since 1991, and now is quite experienced. He sells the cows alive to the local market or to butcheries. His mother milks cows, they use the milk for their own needs and also sell milk and diary products. As cattle breeding is traditional in this region, it can bring a good income. Raset wants to develop this business. He wants to buy two more cows to add to his livestock.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Total 2087(B) Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old and divorced with four children. Jane and Agnes sell fresh foods in the market. Agnes wants to use the extra profits from their business to secure another stall at the market. Eleth sells second-hand clothes and wants to use the loan to add inventory. Joyce has a beauty salon. Lydia sells sand.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in the businesses

loans.name: Ufaya

texts.en: Ufaya is a 40-year-old local resident of the town of Saatli. She is widowed and lives with her four children. She breeds cattle in her yard. She has been in this business for 20 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region. This is their only source of income, and it can be a good income. Ufaya wants to buy two more calves to add to her livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $500.

loans.use: To increase her number of cows

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: K. Gulnora lives in Nau. She is married and has 4 children. She has 5 years experience in her business. She started the business selling small wares, but previous loans she has taken have helped her to widen her business with her own trading outlet. Now she has a trade outlet in a flea bazaar selling children's wear, men's wear and shoes. She has a good assortment and repeat customers. Now Mrs. K. requests a loan of $1025 to purchase new models and widen her assortment.

loans.use: To purchase new models and widen assortment

loans.name: Nabweru South Ii(A) Group

texts.en:
This group of women has been together for six months. Dizzy is 41 years old and married with six children. She has a chicken roasting business. With the extra business profits she earns, she wants to start rearing chickens herself so that she doesn't have to buy from other people. She believes this will reduce costs and thus increase profits. Annet has a cosmetic shop. Josephine sells crafts.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and goods for their businesses

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: U. Rahima lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. She became a client of MicroInvest because she heard many successful stories from friends about the MicroInvest loan procedure that had helped her friends to develop and improve their businesses. Thus she became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. The business stability and increase in income helped her to return her previous loan on time. Mrs. U. is engaged in selling materials. She has a good assortment (different types of material and different tinting). She is a very polite and sensitive person, which is why she has repeat customers and a good business turnover. Now Mrs. U. requests a loan of $1075 to purchase new materials.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
N. Rano is 42 years old. She is married with three children. Her elder daughter is already married and two younger ones are still living with their parents.

Rano's husband does not earn much. In order to help him and to support her family, Rano has been running an electrical goods sales business, which is in its 10th year. All the equipment is imported from Uzbekistan and other countries. Her business generates the significant income for her family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.

Rano is requesting US$1,000 for a term of 12 months. Rano intends to spend the loan to purchase new household appliances like refrigerators, electrical ovens and electrical heaters. Rano has been an IMON client since 2001 and has shown herself to be a reliable client with good credit history.

loans.use: To purchase new electrical goods like refrigerators, electrical ovens, electrical heaters for selling.

loans.name: Nabweru South Ii(B) Group

texts.en:
This group of women has been together for fifteen months. They each have their own businesses. Linda makes and sells snacks. She wants to pay the school fees for her children with the extra business profits she earns. Edith wants to increase the inventory in her retail shop. Madina sells fresh foods. Mariam sells raw foods.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add to their business

loans.name: Rafiga

texts.en: Rafiga is a 47-year-old local resident of the town of Saatli. She breeds cattle in her yard. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. Rafiga wants to develop this business, to increase the number of cows. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $500.

loans.use: To increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Nabweru South Ii (C) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for fifteen months. Teddy, Hadijah and Dorothy all have retail shop businesses. With the extra business profits, she wants to buy a motorcycle for commercial purposes. Margret sells dry beans and wants to add in more stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in stock in the retail shop.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en: Bahar is 40 years old, and a local resident of the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She breeds cattle in her yard together with her husband. They have been engaged in this business for 15 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. They also sell milk and other diary products. Bahar wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle for the family business.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 29 years old. He has 3 children. Two of them are studying in school. One of his children has diabetes. He has an old taxi, and he applied to borrow $1000 to purchase new tires and some spare parts. He also wants to fix up the inside and paint it in order to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new tires and some spare parts

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.en: Sharafat is a 43-year-old local resident in the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She breeds cattle together with her husband. They have been engaged in this business for 20 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where there are no other jobs. Sharafat wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Nabweru South Ii(D) Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, Kevina, Madina, and Muyiga have been together for fifteen months. Sharifa currently makes and sells snacks. She would like to set up a retail shop. Muyiga runs a clinic and would like to purchase more furniture. Suzan owns a drug store, Madina has a beauty salon, and Kevina has a brick laying business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase her business volume

loans.name: Aybeniz

texts.en: Aybeniz is a 36-year-old local resident of the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. She breeds cattle together with her family. (Her mother is shown in the picture). They have engaged in this business for 25 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Nabweru Iii A 2030(A) Group

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 35 year old wife and mother of 3 children from Nansana, Uganda. Over a year ago, she founded a restaurant and has since grown it into a successful dining and catering enterprise, with her partners, Margret, Resty, Hellen and Juliet, who provide an important part of Jeniffer’s produce. To further expand her business, she needs your help. With your loan she could grow her restaurant and continue to improve Uganda’s food service industry and her community.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve her catering business

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.en: A. Shokirjon lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is engaged in the business of selling men's wear and underclothes. He has his own trade outlet in a flea bazaar. He has a good assortment (sportswear, socks, jackets, underclothes, etc.) that he buys straight from suppliers. Now Mr. A. requests a loan of $1200 to purchase new winter wear.

loans.use: To purchase new winter wear

loans.name: Nabweru Iii A 2030(B) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Lydia makes and sells snacks. With the extra business profits, she wants to set up a stall so that she can begin supplying other small scale buyers. Jane offers tailoring services. Jane has a retail shop while Sarah sells raw foods in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her catering business.

loans.name: Nabweru Iii A 2030(C) Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is 26 years old and married with two children. She has a poultry business. She wants to use the extra profits to construct another poultry house. Edith sells used clothes. Agnes makes and sells snacks. Maregret has a charcoal selling business and wants to use the loan to expand the business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en: B. Dilshod lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. Mr. B. is engaged in the business of selling medicine. He rents a pharmacy in a food bazaar and has a good assortment (medicine that he receives straight from factory suppliers). It is the municipal pharmacy which is why prices for the medicine are lower than normal bazaar prices. Now Mr. B. requests a loan of $1200 to open a homeopathic department.

loans.use: To help open a homeopathic department

loans.name: Nabweru Iii A 2030(D) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Jackies is 28 years old and married with two children. She has a beauty salon. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy a steamer. Annet has a poultry business while Margret sells African crafts.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier

loans.name: Katooke Iii 2039(A) Group

texts.en:
Jesca is 33 years old and divorced with four children. She sells hardware equipment. With the extra business profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children and provide other necessities for them. Faith owns a restaurant and wants to use the loan to purchase more furniture. Justine has a brick laying business. Agnes is a poultry farmer while Rose sells used clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in her business

loans.name: Negmat

texts.en: S. Negmat lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2003. His stable business development and steady income has helped him to return his previous loans on time and to improve his business. Mr. S. is engaged in a home business of raising and selling livestock. It is the family business within which his wife is engaged in milk production and selling. He has 20 years experience in the business. Now Mr. S. requests a loan of $625 to purchase mixed fodder.

loans.use: To purchase mixed fodder

loans.name: Katooke Iii 2039(B) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year and six months. Aminah is married with two children and owns a retail shop that sells used clothes. She intends to save the extra profits for a poultry business. Madina owns a restaurant while Hadija sells charcoal.

loans.use: To add more stock in her business

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en: U. Ilhom lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Mr. U. has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2004. He is engaged in a home business of raising and selling livestock. He is a school teacher but he continues working with his father's business of raising livestock. Mr. U. has 10 years experience selling livestock and he dreams of a large herd. Now Mr. U. requests a loan of $625 to purchase mixed fodder.

loans.use: To purchase mixed fodder

loans.name: Katooke Iii 2039(C) Group

texts.en:
Grace has a poultry business. With the extra business profits, she intends to re-invest in the business. Jane has a brick laying business. Eva sells used shoes and wants to use the loan to increase stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Abdugappor

texts.en:
S. Abdugappor lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 5 children. Mr.S. became the client of MicroInvest because he had heard many successful stories from friends about the MicroInvest loan procedure that helped his friends to develop and improve their businesses. Thus he has been a client of MicroInvest since 2003. His loans improve his business stability and increased his income which helped him to return his previous loans on time.

He is engaged in a home business of raising and selling livestock. He has 20 years of experience in this business and has developed the appropriate skills to use in the practice. Now Mr. S. requests a loan of $625 to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Katooke Iii 2039(D) Group

texts.en:
With the extra business profits, Teo wants improve the health standards of his children and also pay their school fees. Rose sells cold drinks and wants to use the loan to buy a new fridge. Sarah offers secretarial services, while Winfred sells scrap.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add more stock in her hardware shop

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im C., 33, is the mother of two children and works as a fish seller, earning on average around $1.50 each day in profit. Her husband works as a security guard and generally makes around $3.30 per day. All the income she and her husband make is not enough so that she could accumulate savings; it goes to support her family.

In order to raise her income generation, Mrs. Im C. would like to request a loan to purchase her husband a motorcycle that he will use to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase her husband a motorcycle  that he will use to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Katooke Iii 2039(E) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for seven months. Eva is a 37 year old widow with six children. She has a hardware business. She wants to use the extra business profits to pay school fees fr the children. Sarah has a poultry business and wants to buy poultry feed with the loan. Annet sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to increase stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-stock the hardware shop.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak S., 47, works with her husband on their farmland growing rice and can generally make only about $2 each day in revenue. Mrs. Prak S. has six children. One of them is self-employed as a carpenter making tables, chairs, cabinets and variety of wooden furniture; one is currently unemployed and the rest are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Prak S. is currently requesting a loan to enable her to purchase a Tuk-Tuk (motorcycle taxi) for her unemployed child to drive in order to generate additional income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk-Tuk (motorcycle taxi) for her unemployed child to generate additional income for the family

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Prak Sambou has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Munaku A(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Christine has a retail shop business. She wants to use the extra profits to re-invest in the business. Sarah sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to add to her stock. Jane offers tailoring services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more items like sugar, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Mrs. Tang S. is thirty-one years old and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her plot of land, breeding pigs and growing cashew nuts, making on average around $7 each day in revenue. Her husband meanwhile works as a horse-cart driver, transporting passengers, and can earn about $6 each day.

Mrs. Tang S. has two children. One of them is enrolled in school and the rest are still too young to go to school. She hopes to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of cashew nuts from the growers and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts in bulk from the growers

loans.name: Munaku A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Zaina is 30 years old and married with four children. She owns a retail shop, and with extra business profits, wants to construct a residential house. Robinah and Jackie have beauty salons, and Margaret sells firewood for a living. Ruth sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more retail shop items.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
J. Gulchehra lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is a single mother bringing up 3 children. Despite this fact she is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work as she dreams of a happy future for her children. Mrs.J. is engaged in the business of selling children's clothes and underclothes. She has her own trade outlet in a flea bazaar that brings her a stable income. She has a good assortment of clothes and repeat customers.

Now Mrs. J. requests a loan of $725 to purchase new goods (importing infant wear).

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Munaku B(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Hellen is 30 years old and married with five children. She sells raw matooke (a foodstuff) in the market. She intends to use the extra profits to repay the loan. Safina has a drug shop and wants to use the loan to increase her stock. Jennifer has a retail shop while Cate works in a hotel.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more matooke for sale.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai C. L., 49, is married with seven children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works hulling rice and selling clothes to the people in her area, making around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband is both a construction foreman and a blacksmith, earning around $10 each day in revenue. Five of their children attend school and the other two are married and live separately.

Mrs. Thai C. L. hopes to use this loan to purchase more rice from the growers for her grinding mill and buy more construction tools to facilitate her husband’s work.

loans.use: To purchase more rice from the growers for her mill and buy more construction tools for her husband

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: K. Zainab lives in the Nausky region. She is married and has 4 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. Mrs. K. Zainab is engaged in a home business baking and selling national bread (Lepeshky). She has 9 years of experience in the business. Now Mrs. K. Zainab requests a loan of $900 to purchase flour.

loans.use: To purchase flour

loans.name: Munaku B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Sarah has a beauty salon. She wants to use the extra profits to build a residential house and also repay the loan. Rose, Mukasa and Faridah all make and sell snacks. Allen sells shoes and wants to use the loan to increase stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in salon business

loans.name: Chit

texts.en: Mrs. Chit T., 36, is a widow and lives with her school-age child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her household, she works selling a variety of grocery products and provisions to the people in her area and makes on average around $5 each day in profit. Mrs. Chit T. hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand

loans.name: Munaku B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Solome is 36 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells snacks. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children. Ruth bakes cakes and wants to buy a fridge with the loan. Alice and H. both sell timber, while Prossy sells soft drinks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in snack business

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
A. Lola lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. She became the client of MicroInvest because she heard many successful stories from friends who had been through the MicroInvest loan procedure and had helped her friends to develop and improve their businesses. Thus she has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. The business stability and increase in income from her previous loans helped her to return her loans in time.

Mrs. A. is engaged in the furniture making and selling business. She has 7 years of experience in this business. Now Mrs. A. requests a loan of $725 for purchasing upholstery.

loans.use: For purchasing upholstery

loans.name: Tok

texts.en:
Mrs. Tok H., 38, is married with one school-age child and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She can usually earn about $2.50 each day in profit from selling her rice. Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver making typically around $4.60/day in revenue.

Mrs. Tok H. has lately requested a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing a large quantity of rice from the growers to meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of rice from the growers

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: T. Dilbar lives in Spitamen. She is married and has 3 children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. Mrs. T. Dilbar started her business practically from scratch and now she has her own shop selling food products (wholesale and retail sales of drinks, sweeties, pastries, milk-sour products, meat products, oil, flour products, etc). Now Mrs. T. Dilbar requests a loan of $1200 to increase the range of assortment and business development.

loans.use: To increase range of assortment and business development

loans.name: Munaku B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Florence is 30 years old and married with one child. Florence, Rose and Allen all sell used clothes. Florence wants to use the extra profits to re-invest in the business. Night sells raw foods while Agnes has a beauty salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mrs. Mey P., 25, is married with one child and stays at home cooking food for her family. Her husband is the one who handles all his family’s expense by earning on average about $9/day in income working as a blacksmith. He is very talented and has experience with this job since 1998.

Mrs. Mey P. has applied for a loan to purchase more blacksmith’s tools and various kinds of spare parts to facilitate her husband’s work.

loans.use: To purchase more blacksmith’s tools and various kinds of spare parts to facilitate her husband’s work

loans.name: Munaku B(V) Group

texts.en:
Hanifah and Margret have a salon businesses. With the extra profits, Hanifah wants to construct a residential home. Adrian sells charcoal. Margret has a retail shop business while Annet sells raw foods in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in business

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich S., 46, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has worked as a primary school teacher since 1980 making $2 each day, while her husband works driving a motor-taxi, earning on average about $5 per day in income. One of her children is employed in a hotel and the others are married and live separately.

Mrs. Pich S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her son to use to go work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to use to go to work

loans.name: Munaku B(Vi) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Phiona is 30 years old, and she is a single mother of one child. She sells fruits and vegetables. She wants to use the extra profits to re-invest in the fruit business. Josephine, Jackline and Prossy all sell used clothes and want to use the loan to expand their businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Mrs. Kung P. is 28 years old and is the mother of three children. She works as a market vendor selling fish and typically earns on average around $8 each day in revenue. Her husband works driving a Tuk-Tuk (motorcycle taxi) transporting tourists to visit the fascinating temples of the Angkor complex, making about $4 each day. Two of their children are currently enrolled in school and the third is too young to go to school.

Mrs. Kung P. has lately applied for a loan to enable her to purchase more dry fish to expand her inventory as well as meeting her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more dry fish to expand her inventory

loans.name: Mirsada

texts.en:
Mirsada was born in 1979 and she lives in a small village called Zukići. She is married and her husband owns and drives a tractor transporting wood from the forest. In his free time he also does agricultural work, so he can earn some money in that way, too. Their monthly incomes are about US$ 375. Mirsada earns money by selling milk products and she can earn about US$ 260. They have a son and he is 8 years old.

This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 450. She is going to buy a calf and she will fatten it with their other livestock. She is expecting that after 12 months, when the calf is fattened and her income increases because of it, she will be able to buy 2 more calves and thus expand her little business activity.

loans.use: Buying a calf to raise

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoeun C., 53, is the mother of six children and lives in Siem Reap province, Angkor complex, Cambodia. She is a housewife and is handicapped. Her husband is employed as a temple guard, making on average around $1.80 each day and two of her children work selling various kinds of souvenir products to tourists passing by. The rest of her children are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Chhoeun C. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Chhoeun C. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her family's transportation

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift Agharomi is a 32-year old happily married woman. She comes from Shibiri in Lagos State Nigeria.

She sells cooked food and drinks. She has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy a deep freezer so she could sell iced water and blocks of ice. She has been a client of Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) for the past 2 years.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer to sell iced  Water.

loans.name: Munak Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Rose has a retail shop business. With the extra profits, Rose wants to repay the loan and re-invest in the retail shop. Prossy sells used clothes. Sarah has a cosmetic shop. Ritah sells firewood and Madinah has a beauty salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in stock

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P., 49, lives with her husband and five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works selling rice and a variety of Khmer food to the people in her area, earning about $5 each day in profit. Her husband works as a fisherman and typically earns about $2 each day from selling his fish. Four of her children are enrolled in school and the other is currently unemployed.

Mrs. Sok P. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle with a trailer for her unemployed child so that he can use it to transport passengers in his area. This will enable Mrs. Sok P.’s family make additional income and raise their standard of living. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Sok P. was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle with a trailer to use to transport passengers

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Madame A. Adjowa est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Très dynamique, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage grâce aux revenus de son commerce de vente de denrées alimentaires. Très exigeante en matière d’hygiène, elle est beaucoup appréciée par les habitants de son milieu.

Ayant pour ambition de renforcer son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $300 qui va lui permettre de constituer un stock permanent de riz, haricot huile et autres pour sa restauration. Ceci améliorera ses revenus ainsi que les conditions de vie au sein de son foyer.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Adjowa A. is married and mother of six children. She is a very dynamic woman who uses the income from her food-selling business to contribute to her household expenses. Fastidious with respect to hygiene, she is highly esteemed by local residents.

Wishing to strengthen her catering business, she is asking for a loan of $300 that will allow her to build up a permanent stock of rice, beans, oil and so on. This will allow Madame A. to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to stock up on rice, beans and oil for her catering business

loans.name: Advija

texts.en:
Advija was born in 1965 and she lives in a village called Gornje Dubrave, near Živinice. Her husband is a seasonal worker in construction. When he works, he can earn around US$ 1100. But in the times when he can't find work, Advija's income supports the family. She sells clothes at the market and in a little shop she has rented.

Advija has one son and he is going to primary school at Dubrave. He is 9 years old. She is planning to invest this credit in the amount of US$ 900 in the shop and buy more clothes for resale. She hopes that she will earn more money and that she might some day be able to buy the shop she is renting for her business.

loans.use: Buying more inventory for her little clothing shop

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan L., 26, is married with two school-age children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has no job outside the home but stays at home cooking food for her family, while her husband is employed as a security-guard and typically makes on average around $5 each day.

L. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to ride to work. With a new motorcycle, her husband will save a lot of money that he presently has to spend using a motor-taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to go to work

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Né en 1971 à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio, Monsieur DJOKA Yaovi a fait des études primaires mais par manque de moyen n’a pas pu continuer. Marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, il subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus de ses travaux champêtres et au taxi moto. Grâce à son expérience, il maîtrise bien son activité. Dynamique et honnête, il a déjà remboursé un précédent crédit de $500.

A présent, il fait une nouvelle demande de $1000 qui lui servira à acquérir une nouvelle moto et à étendre son domaine agricole. Par ce crédit, il pense mieux rentabiliser les activités pour réaliser le maximum de profit afin de mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Born in 1971 at Havé Doumé in the Zio prefecture, Monsieur Yaovi DJOKA had to discontinue his education after elementary school due to lack of means. Married and father to five children, he provides for his family by working in the fields and running a motorcycle taxi. Being experienced, he manages his business very well. Dynamic and honest, he has already paid back a previous loan of $500.

He is now requesting a new loan of $1,000 to allow him to purchase a new motorcycle and to extend his agricultural property. With this loan, Monsieur DJOKA intends to increase the profitability of his businesses and make as much money as possible in order to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To puchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Hoindossi

texts.fr:
Madame K. Hoindossi est une femme très dévouée. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants et a à sa charge deux (2) petites sœurs en apprentissage. Elle peine énormément pour couvrir les dépenses de la famille car son activité de vente de produits de première nécessité ne rapporte pas assez car elle manque de moyens. Malgré que ce commerce soit florissant, Madame K. n’en jouit pas convenablement. Voulant renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un financement de $400 pour agrandir son étalage et s’approvisionner en produits alimentaires afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. L’octroi de ce crédit lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Hoindossi K. is a very dedicated woman. Married to a farmer, she is mother to five children and supports her two younger sisters who are apprentices. She has great difficulty covering the family expenses, as her business—selling basic products—does not bring in sufficient revenue due to a lack of financial resources. Despite the fact that her business is flourishing, Madame K. could make more of it. Wishing to strengthen her business, she is requesting a $400 loan to expand her display of goods and stock up on food products in order to meet the needs of her clientele. The granting of this loan will help Madame K. to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Born in 1959 in Havé Doumé in the Zio prefecture, Madam D. Ayawa quit her studies in primary school to launch herself in small business. Married and the mother of five (5) children, she provides the necessities for her family thanks to her produce farming and sales of smoked fish. Dynamic and serious, she understood well how to manage her first two loans, which were reimbursed without incident. At present she requests a loan of $850 that will allow her to purchase a larger quantity of fish and to improve her produce farming. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income in order to better contribute to the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1959 à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio, Madame D. Ayawa a cessé les études au cours primaire pour se lancer dans le petit commerce. Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce au maraîchage et à la vente de poissons fumés. Dynamique et sérieuse, elle a su bien gérer ses deux premiers crédits qui ont été remboursés sans incident. A présent elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à l’achat en quantité suffisante de poissons et au renforcement de son activité de maraîchage. Par ce crédit, elle pense augmenter ses revenus pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase fish for drying and resale and to purchase supplies for produce farming.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi M. is 28 years old, married and has 2 children. She comes from Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria.

She designs and tailor's clothing for her clients, and have been in business for 5 years. She's requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials for sale. She has been with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) as a client for the past 2 years.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Born in 1976 in Havé Doumé in the Zio prefecture, Mr K. Anani is married and the father of three (3) children. A professional farmer, he finds that the soil has returned a poor profit. So he has decided to get a taxi bike and, with this, to be able to provide the necessities for the family. His woman, also a farmer, contributes very little to the family expenditures. An honest man, he has demonstrated good management of his affairs until now. To have a new bike and new fertile soil, he requests a loan of $1000. Thus will he be able to efficiently contribute to the improvement of the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1976 à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio, Monsieur K. Anani est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Cultivateur de profession, il constate que la terre lui rapportait peu de bénéfice. Alors il décida de faire taxi moto et, avec celui-ci, il arrive subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Sa femme, cultivatrice aussi contribue très peu dans les dépenses de la famille. Honnête, il fait preuve d’une bonne gestion de ses activités jusqu’à ce jour. Pour avoir une nouvelle moto et de nouvelles terres fertiles, il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Il pourra ainsi efficacement contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a taxi bike

loans.name: Mawuéna

texts.fr:
The father of a family of six (06) children, Mister Mawuéna K. is a professional farmer. With the difficulties that hold sway, he increases his efforts in the sale of dried hot peppers. Having finished secondary school, he has a good understanding regarding the drying and storage of hot peppers. Today he requests a loan of $400 in order to prepare a larger amount of dry hot peppers for sale in times when they are scarce. The earned profits of this activity will allow for him to provide the necessities for the family and also improve his capacity to save for the future.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Père de famille de six (06) enfants, Monsieur Mawuéna K. est un cultivateur de profession. Avec les difficultés qui sévissent, il accentue plus ses efforts dans la vente de piments séchés. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il possède une bonne expérience en matière de séchage et de stockage de piments. Il sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $400 afin de faire un stockage plus important de piments secs pour la vente en période de pénurie. Les bénéfices tirés de cette activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et aussi améliorer sa capacité d’épargner pour faire face à l’avenir.

loans.use: To purchase hot peppers to dry and resell

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en:
Omowumi A. is 42 years old, happily married and has 2 children. She comes from Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells wine and soft drinks and has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more wine and soft drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more wine and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Kossi Jacques

texts.fr:
Born in 1979 in Havé Doumé in the Zio prefecture, Mister D. Kossi Jacques is married and has four (04) children. He provides the necessities for his family thanks to the country work projects and to his taxi bike. Working for a third person who does nothing but exploit him, he has decided to obtain his own bike that would allow for him to have financial stability for the family needs. His spouse is a student hairdresser who brings in too little money to contribute effectively to the family expenses. He requests a loan of $1000 to buy his own bike and work for himself. This project will allow for him to increase his income in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1979 à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio, Monsieur D. Kossi Jacques est marié et a en charges quatre (04) enfants. Il subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux travaux champêtres et au taxi moto. Travaillant pour une tierce personne qui ne fait que l’exploiter, il décide d’acquérir sa propre moto qui lui permettra d’avoir une stabilité financière pour les besoins de la famille. Son épouse coiffeuse de formation tire très peu de profit pour contribuer effectivement aux charges familiales.

Il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter sa propre moto et travailler en son propre compte. Ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour une amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy a taxi bike

loans.name: Soaméto

texts.fr:
A young married lady and mother of three (03) children, Madam K. Soaméto is also responsible for two (02) children of her older sister, who is deceased. Having a principal activity of gardening, Madam K. is not always able to earn enough to meet her expenses. Today she requests a loan of $400 in order to buy fertilizer to improve her yield and to better to satisfy her clientele. This will improve her income as well as the living conditions of her home.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune dame mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame K. Soaméto a aussi à sa charge deux (02) enfants de sa grande sœur décédée. Ayant pour activité principale le jardinage, Madame K. n’arrive toujours pas à joindre les deux bouts. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un financement de $400 afin de s’acheter de l’engrais pour améliorer son rendement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci améliorera ses revenus ainsi que les conditions de vie de son foyer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Koato Hodé

texts.fr:
Madam K. Koato Hodé is a young married woman and mother of five (05) children. Her age gives an energy to her work. Very determined, she has a passion for gardening that she has practiced for almost 8 years. The income that she draws from it, although insignificant, allows for her to contribute significantly to the household expenses. Faced with impoverishment, her yield will be less this year if she does not do something. To address this, she requests a loan of $400 for the purchase of fertilizer and insecticide. This will increase her sales in order to better provide the necessities for her family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Koato Hodé est une jeune femme mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son âge lui confère un dynamisme dans son activité. Très endurante, elle a une passion pour le jardinage qu’elle exerce depuis près de 8 ans. Le revenu qu’elle en tire quoique insignifiant lui permet de contribuer largement aux charges du ménage.

Devant l’appauvrissement du sol, son rendement sera moins cette année s’elle n’arrive pas à rien faire. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un financement de $400 pour l’achat d’engrais et d’insecticide. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide in order to improve the yield of her gardens.

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Cathérine A. was born on 5 May 1973 in Adidogomé. She did not have the chance to socialize much - at a young age, she helped her parents in working in the fields and at home. Having become an adult, she has never had the chance to learn a trade. She obtained her first loan to sell earrings, and so now she is no longer entirely dependent on her husband. Moreover, she is able to contribute to the household expenses. Married and the mother of one (1) child, she has another child of her husband's in her care. Dynamic and honest, she was able to repay her first loan without problems, and is now asking for another one. This new request for $200 will allow her to go to the Cotonou market in Accra to sell jewelry, bracelets, and other goods. With this income, she hopes to do more for her family, especially the children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Cathérine est née le 05 mai 1973 à Adidogomé. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. A bas âge, elle aidait les parents dans les travaux champêtres et domestiques. Devenue majeure et n’ayant appris aucun métier. Elle sollicita un premier crédit pour la vente de boucles d’oreilles, et aujourd’hui elle ne dépend plus entièrement de son mari. D’ailleurs elle contribue plus aux charges de la famille. Mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant, elle a un autre enfant de son mari en charge. Dynamique et honnête, elle a pu rembourser normalement son crédit et sollicite un autre. Cette nouvelle demande de $200 va lui permettre à faire le marché de Cotonou et d’Accra pour la vente des bijoux, bracelets et autres. Avec les revenus, elle espère faire plus à la famille surtout aux enfants.

loans.use: To stock up on and sell earrings

loans.name: Tolani

texts.en:
Tolami O. is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. She comes from Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells cooked food to people living in her community and has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more foodstuff for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Sanu Rana

texts.en: Mrs. Sanu Rana M. and her husband Mr. Gamber Rana M. are both farmers in a village called Sainbu-Bhaishapati in Nepal. They grow various types of vegetables, mainly seasonal, on their own land.  They have two sons, the eldest of which is an electrician and the younger who is in Grade 12 at school. Mr. M. supplements their farming income by working at an office. Mrs. M. is requesting for her first loan of Rs10000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She wants to stand on her own two feet and together with her husband to uplift the standard of living of their family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Simésso

texts.fr:
Married and mother of six (06) children, Mrs. Simésso A. is a gardener by primary occupation. The income from her business is meagre due to the low yield of the soil and the destruction of the majority of her garden by insects. All of this leads to a lack of sufficient means to cover the basic needs of the family.

To remedy this situation, she is asking for a loan of $400 to buy fertilizer and insecticide in order to increase her agricultural yield and satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, Madame A. Simésso à pour activité principale le jardinage. Le revenu de son activité toujours maigre dû au mauvais rendement du sol et la destruction de la majeur partie du jardin par les insectes. Tout ceci a pour conséquence l’insuffisance de couverture des besoins vitaux de la famille. Pour remédier à cela, elle sollicite un financement de $400 afin de pouvoir s’acheter de l’engrais et d’insecticides afin d’accroître son rendement agricole et satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Aduni

texts.en:
Aduni A. is a 42- year- old divorce and has 2 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.
