She sells drinks and water to people living in her community. She has been in business since 2000. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more drinks and water for sale. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for the past 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and water for sale

loans.name: Maina

texts.en: Mrs. Maina T. lives with her husband and one son in a village called Sainbu-Bhaishapati in Nepal. Her son is eleven years old and is studying in primary school.  Mrs. Maina T. and her husband Mr. Dipak T. are both farmers and grow seasonal vegetables on their land. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the mornings and evenings and Mrs. T. is seeking a loan of Rs 10000 that will allow her to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en:
Amaka C. is 26 years old, married and has one child. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells groceries to people living in her community. She has been in business since 2006. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more groceries for sale. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for the past 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for sale

loans.name: Houndjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Houndjo K. was born in Havé Doumé in the Prefecture of Zio in 1975. He did not have the chance to attend school. Married and the father of four (04) children with one more in his care, he meets the needs of his family thanks to agricultural work and a motorcycle taxi service. His wife, a retailer, helps him from time to time in his work in the fields. Thanks to his experience, he manages his business well. Dynamic and courageous, he has already repaid a previous loan of $400.

Currently, this new loan request of $1000 will serve to expand his crops, such as maize, peanuts, and others, and also to acquire a new motorcycle for transport. This will allow him to increase his yield and improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Houndjo est né à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio dans l'année 1975. Il n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants et autre en charge, il subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux travaux champêtres et au taxi moto. Sa femme revendeuse, l’aide de temps en temps dans ses activités champêtres Grâce à son expérience, il maîtrise bien son activité. Dynamique et courageux, il a déjà remboursé un précédent crédit de $400.

A présent, cette nouvelle demande de crédit de $1000 lui servira à développer les cultures vivrières tels que le mais, l’arachide, et autres et à acquérir une nouvelle moto pour le transport. Ceci va lui permettre d’avoir beaucoup de rendement et de surcroît améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis, age 23, is married with 2 children (ages 8 and 3). She has a business selling sarongs which she began 6 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 6pm daily.

Mwanahamis took out 2 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to buy land and build a small house. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her sarong business.

loans.use: To increase her business

payments.comment: This business was accidently posted with a loan term of 16 months instead of 16 weeks. Tujijenge is apologizing for this mistake. The loan term has now been completed as of this month,Mwanahamis Abdalah has repaid the loan successfully.

loans.name: Dayowo

texts.fr:
Born in 1947, Mrs. Dayowo D. is the mother of six (06) children who are still in school. Her main business is the sale of maize, which allows her contribute to the household expenses. Having mastered her trade well, she has found a way to survive, but her funds are still insufficient to expand her business. Thus, being unable to satisfy the demands of the clientele, she is asking for a loan of $350, which will let her maintain a consistent stock of maize. This will allow her to increase her sales and ensure the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1947, Madame D. Dayowo est mère de six (06) enfants encore en scolarité. Son activité principale est la vente de maïs pour pouvoir contribuer aux charges du ménage. Maîtrisant bien son activité, elle arrive bien à s’en sortir mais son fonds de commerce reste insuffisant pour développer son activité. Ainsi, ne pouvant plus satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement de $350 qui va lui servir à faire un stockage consistant de maïs. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour un bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock maize

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en:
Mrs. Ramila K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Her husband, Mr. Ram Hari K., works at a local printing press. Their elder daughter is studying in grade 9 and her younger daughter is in pre-primary school.
Mrs Ramila K. spends her mornings selling milk door to door in her village. Because of rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production.  Mrs. K. is seeking a loan of Rs20000 to purchase a jersey cow which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: To buy young milk giving cow

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa J. is 57 years old, married and has 5 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells groceries, foodstuff and drinks to people. She has been in business since 1998. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more groceries, foodstuff and drinks for sale. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for the past 2 years. She wishes to thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more groceries, foodstuff and drinks for sale

loans.name: Ratna Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratna Devi M. Lives in Thecho Village, one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur district of Nepal, where most of people are engaged in farming.
Mrs. M. lives with her husband and two sons. Her elder son is studying in grade 6 and her younger son is only two years old.
Mrs. M. and her husband Mr. Krishna Gopal M. opened their mustard oil store 5 years ago. They buy oil directly from mill and sell it in the local market. 
She is asking for her third loan of Rs 20000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Manowoha

texts.fr:
47 years old, Mrs. Manowoha K. is married and has seven (07) children. With her business selling maize, she is able to contribute towards the household expenses. Currently, she has gained a great deal of experience, which allows her to profit well from her business. Thanks to her excellent management skills, she has been able to repay all her previous loans without incident.

She is asking for a loan of $350 to increase her storage capacity, in order to sell her products in times of need. The realization of this dream will be very beneficial to her, and she will also succeed in satisfying her clientele and better meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 47 ans, Madame K. Manowoha est une femme mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Avec son commerce de vente de maïs, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage. Aujourd’hui, elle a acquis une grande expérience qui lui permet de bien profiter de son activité. Grâce à son sens élevé de gestion, elle a pu rembourser tous ses crédits antérieurs sans incident.

Elle sollicite un financement de $350 pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage afin de vendre ses produits en temps de pénurie. La réalisation de ce rêve lui sera très bénéfique, aussi elle réussira à bien satisfaire sa clientèle et mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock maize

loans.name: Mulikat

texts.en:
Mulikat A. is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells food supplies and wine to people. She has been in business since 1992. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more food and wine for sale. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for the past 2 years. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more food and wine for sale

loans.name: Yawa Holali

texts.fr:
Born in 1972, Mrs. Yawa Holali A. did not have the chance to go to school. Married, she has four (04) children. For more than 15 years, she has turned manioc into gari (flour), and also practiced agriculture. With these activities, she meets the dietary needs of her children as well as she can. Her husband, a farmer and gravel harvester, gives her a hand with the education of the children. Honest and dynamic, she managed her three previous loans well. In order to extend her agricultural options, she is asking for a loan of $750, which will serve to grow maize, manioc, okra, and peanuts. A portion of the loan is destined for the transformation of manioc into gari. She will thus be able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1972, Madame A. Yawa Holali n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle fait depuis plus de 15 ans la transformation du manioc en gari et l’agriculture. A partir de ces activités, elle assume tant bien que mal les besoins alimentaires des enfants. Son mari agriculteur et exploitant de gravier lui donne des coups de mains dans l’éducation des enfants. Honnête et dynamique, elle a su gérer les trois précédents crédits obtenus. Afin d’étendre sa surface cultivable, elle sollicite un appui financier de $750 qui servira à faire la culture de maïs, de manioc, de gombo et d’arachide. Une partie va être destinée à la transformation du manioc en « gari ». Elle pourra ainsi subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To grow food crops

loans.name: Pancha Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Pancha Maiya M. is 45 years old and lives in Thecho village with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Astaman M. is unemployed. Her elder son makes traditional idols and her younger son is studying in grade7.
Mrs. Pancha Maiya M. sells goats directly to dealers. She started this business 4-5 years ago. She is happy and satisfied with her income and is seeking her third loan of Rs20,000 to buy 20 goats for raising. She started her business because she wants to be independent and she also wants to help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase goats for raising and resale

loans.name: Agossou

texts.fr:
At the age of 46, Mr. Agossou A. is married and the father of 7 children. He is a farmer and also sells dried red chili peppers as a secondary business. His soil is becoming expended and capricious weather has contributed to make his harvests smaller and smaller. Since he has to support his family, he is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to get his dried chili pepper business up and running again. This amount will permit him to keep a constant stock available to sell in times of shortage. The income from this venture will allow him to take care of his family's needs and lead a peaceful life.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A l’âge de 46 ans, Monsieur A. Agossou est marié et père de sept (07) enfants. Cultivateur de profession, il fait aussi comme seconde activité la vente du piment séché. La dégradation de son sol et les caprices de la nature ont rendu son rendement de plus en plus médiocre. Etant dans l’obligation de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il sollicite un financement de $300 pour relancer son commerce de piments séché. Ceci lui permettra de faire un stockage consistant pour la vente en période de pénurie. Les revenus issus de la vente lui permettront de s’occuper de sa famille et de mener une vie paisible.

loans.use:
purchase dried chili peppers for re-sale and also fertilizer for his farm land

stockage de piment et achat d'engrais

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola A. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells clothes and has been in business since 2000. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more clothes for sale. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando, a 37 year old single father, originally from the town of Saldivar who moved ten years ago to the city of Carapeguá. He has always worked to improve his condition in life and began working as an electronics traveling salesman. He is the only one in the town who has progressed quickly and now also sells clothing for all ages.

When he has made enough money from his businesses he wants to settle down, start a family, and have more children. For now however, he is focused on his son and his current business. With this loan he will invest in more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his clothing business.

loans.name: Emile

texts.fr:
Born in 1972, Mr. Emile M. is married and the father of two children. After secondary school, he did an apprenticeship and on completion, received a driver's license. He became a driver and worked for two years for the owner of a vehicle. Now, Mr. M. would like to have a vehicle of his own, but he lacks the necessary financial means. He is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to purchase a vehicle to use as a taxi. The income will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1972, Monsieur Emile M. est un jeune homme marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il se lança en apprentissage qu’il acheva avec un permis de conduire. Devenu chauffeur, il a travaillé pour un propriétaire de véhicule pendant 2 ans. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur M. Emile désire avoir son propre véhicule mais ne dispose pas de moyen. Il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour acheter un véhicule destiné au transport. Les revenus lui serviront à mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase of a vehicle to use as a taxi

Achat de véhicule pour transport

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago is 36 years old and his entire life he has been a hardworking man. He has opened his own tire service shop which is situated along a main highway in the city of Carapeguá, near the cutoff to the city of Alcahay. It is in a great location where there is always a lot of business.

Along with the success of his shop, another great experience in his life has been the recent adoption of his baby. He and his wife were not able to have children of their own. With the loan, Santiago will buy more inner tubes and tools for his tire shop.

loans.use: To buy tire tubes and tools.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Koku A. was born in 1973 in Badou Tomégbé. He was apprenticed for three years and became a mechanic. He is married to a retailer with whom he has three children. Dynamic and a master of his trade, he is a good businessman and has been able to invest wisely and repay the loans he has received in a timely manner.

In view of the present difficult financial situation, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorcycle to use as transport and for his business. This will allow him to make more money and better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Koku est né 1973 à Badou Tomégbé. Devenu mécanicien après trois ans d’apprentissage, il s’est marié à une revendeuse avec qui il a fait trois (3) enfants. Dynamique et maîtrisant son métier, il est un bon entrepreneur et a su gérer les crédits obtenus et les a remboursé sans aucun incident. Pour faire face à la situation économique difficile, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acquérir une moto pour le transport et des matériels de travail. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase of a motorcycle

Achat de moto

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia O. is 54 years old, married and has 7 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells smoked fish. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for 2 years. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more fish for sale. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana Ester A. is a 27 year old single woman and is the only child that lives with her parents. The rest of her siblings have moved to Argentina and are married. For eight years, Diana has been weaving traditional blankets and hammocks with her mother which they then sell in the area. Five years ago, she decided to bring their merchandise to sell throughout the area of the capital and this proved to be very profitable.

Thanks to her work she was able to buy herself a motorcycle which she uses to make her sales. Since her parents depend on her to make the sales in different areas of Paraguay, especially the capital of Asuncion, this investment was a very big step for their business.

With the increase in popularity of her merchandise, Diana has received many requests for more. With this loan she will be buying more hammocks, sheets, table cloths and blankets to sell in her town, in the capital and throughout other small towns.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets, blankets, top sheets, table cloths, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Loumossi

texts.fr:
Born in 1982, Mrs. Loumossi B. is married and mother of three children. Selling beans is her primary business activity. She begins work very early in the morning. Nowadays, dried beans are becoming more and more expensive. To be protected from price surges, Mrs. B. is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 250 to purchase some sacks of dried beans, as well as the condiments she needs to satisfy the demand of her customers. The income from her expanded business will permit her to support her family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1982, Madame B. Loumossi est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. La vente du haricot est sa principale activité. Très tôt le matin, elle vaque librement à ses occupations. Aujourd’hui, cette céréale devient de plus en plus cher. Pour être à l’abri de la flambée du prix, Madame B. Loumossi sollicite un financement de $250 pour s’acheter des sacs de haricot, et autres compléments afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices issus de la vente lui serviront à mieux subvenir aux charges de son ménage.

loans.use:
Purchase of dried beans

Achat et vente d'haricot

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.es:
Mrs. Justiniana D. de Rojas is married and her husband works as a construction worker. She has two adult children that each have their own business.

Justiniana has a clothing booth at the wholesale market which is located in a highly commercial zone. She started her business with little capital, approximately $160, and has grown the business throughout the years.

Mrs. Justiniana wants the loan to buy new clothes for summertime and this way increase her merchandise stock and satisfy all her clients that have all ready put in orders.

Among the clothes she sells are jeans, skirts, blouses, slips, shorts, etc. In the future she would like to open a bigger locale so she can offer her clients more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Justiniana D. de Rojas, es casada, el marido trabaja como constructor de obras; tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad, quienes también ya cuenta con un negocio propio cada uno de ellos.

Justina tiene un puesto de venta de ropas en el Mercado Municipal de Abasto que es una zona altamente comercial. Ella inicio su negocio un pequeño capital no mayor a Gs. 800.000 aproximadamente $ 160, y que fue ampliando con el correr de los años.

La señora Justiniana, retira el préstamo para la compra de nuevas ropas para la temporada de verano de esta forma aumentar su stock de mercaderías y satisfacción a todos los clientes quienes ya le hicieron sus pedidos.

Entre las ropas que vende podemos citar: jeans, faldas, camisas, remeras, shorts, etc. Ella desea en el futuro abrir un local mas grande para poder ofrecer mejor confort a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as jeans, skirts, blouses, slips, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto Velásquez has been married to Sulema Araujo for thirty years and together they have four children. One is still in school and the others have moved out and made families of their own. Since a young age Ernesto has traveled with his brother who works in construction in Argentina as an assistant. It is through his travels that he learned the masonry and construction skills which have now become his profession.

For nineteen years Ernesto worked and saved in Argentina. When he had enough to buy the necessary tools, he moved back to Paraguay and began his business. Today he owns one of the of the best construction companies in town. With a loan he will invest in additional tools to keep his construction business up to date and running smoothly.

loans.use: To buy masonry and construction tools.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi I. is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. She comes from Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells cooked food & drinks in her restaurant. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for 3 years. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more foodstuff & drinks for sale. She wishes to thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff and drinks for sale

loans.name: Eugenio Báez

texts.en:
Eugenio Báez is a 37 year old single man who does not have children now, but hopes for children and a family in the near future. As a young boy he sold blankets and cloth with his father. After some years, Eugenio became independent of his father and began his own bedding sales. There was a great demand for bedding and Eugenio did not want to miss out on the business to be made. Now, he has regular clientele in his hometown of Carapeguá and he also transports his goods to the nearby towns of Nemby, Ypané and Nueva Italia by motorcycle.

Thanks to his work and the help of his parents, Eugenio is living well and his business is flourishing. He is asking for a loan to assist him with his growing business. Because of an increased demand for blankets and hammocks, Eugenio will use the loan to buy these things to provide for his clientele.

loans.use: To buy hammocks and blankets.

loans.name: Ladislaa

texts.es:
Ms. Ladislaa López is single and does not have children. She owns a men’s and women’s clothing stall in the capital city market, called Abasto. She began this business with a small amount of capital that she had saved from her previous job, working as a walking saleswoman.

Ms. Ladislaa would like to purchase summer merchandise, since in her country (Paraguay) the heat is rather intense and she has received many requests for tank tops, shorts, bermudas, short skirts, and jeans, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Srta. Ladislaa López, es soltera, aun no tiene hijos. Ella posee un puesto de ventas de ropas para damas y caballeros en el mercado municipal de la capital, llamado Abasto. Ella inicio este negocio con un pequeño capital que había ahorrado de su oficio anterior, vendedora ambulante.

La señora Ladislaa, desea adquirir mercaderías de temporada verano, pues en nuestro país el calor es bastante intenso y ha recibido muchos pedidos de camisillas, shorts, bermudas, faldas cortas y de jeans, entre otros.

loans.use: to purchase tank tops, shorts, bermudas, short skirts, and jeans, among other things.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector O., a 46 year old native of the city Roque González, has been married to Petrona Fleitas for twenty three years. They have five children. Two still attending school and the older three children have all graduated and are in the working world.

Twenty years ago, Hector began a small convenience store in his house where his wife worked while he was studying to graduate. Hector and his wife, along with their kids have all had a big part in making the convenience store a success. To continue providing for his dedicated customers he will use the loan to buy greater quantities of merchandise for the store like drinks, flour, yerba, leaves for making a tea like drink, pasta and rice.

loans.use: To buy food goods: flour, sugar, pasta, rice, yerba and selected meats.

loans.name: Marta Rosa

texts.en:
Marta R. is a forty our year old woman who is married to Jose R., an electrician. They have three sons, one who is in high school and the others who attend the nearby university. Marta works at their convenience store while her husband travels throughout the city installing electrical appliances.

Marta began this business because she realized that two incomes are necessary in their household in order to pay for their sons’ education. Their sons have the goal of becoming professionals someday and take after their parents as very hard workers. When she opened the convenience store she had a great turnout and in little time had regular clientele.

A successful business that is looking to grow, Marta is asking for a loan to help pay for some of the expenses to expand her business merchandise to include, sugar, flour, rice and pasta.

loans.use: To buy pasta, rice, flour, sugar, and refreshments.

loans.name: Ramona's Group

texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the neighborhood of San José, there is a group of women who meet on a weekly basis to discuss their problem of a shortage of resources along with ways in which to improve their small businesses. They have founded a program, the Committee of Woman Entrepreneurs to discuss their businesses. They are all looking for support and to better their quality of life of their families. In some cases they have even created more jobs for other people.

These women have been meeting for a couple of months now to discuss business plans and strategies. They thank the micro credit organizations that have made their business growth possible. These women are dependent on loans to increase the size of their businesses and become self sufficient. This group of individuals has created a system of checks on their payments. They rely on one another in order to make payments and come to meetings. They trust each other because they understand each other. Each woman is only trying to better her life and the life of her family.

loans.use: The majority of the women involved in the committee have invested their loans to buy goods for their businesses: linens, thread for sewing and embroidery.  Others buy clothes to sell as traveling saleswomen.

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the San Blas neighborhood, a group of women have come together to begin a committee of women entrepreneurs who meet weekly to discuss their businesses and to make payments to their loans. When women come together to form micro credit groups, there is much success. They understand that success comes in numbers and their numbers are large. Sixteen women have come together from various neighborhoods in Carapeguá, and after receiving information about working at fairs and other community activities, they have realized the possibilities how their work can grow.

The women are dependent on the loans to help their businesses grow. With the loans they will purchase goods to make crafts such as linens, thread and embroidery, and also help stock their convenience stores. Together these women have seen much success and will continue to increase the size of their businesses and clientele.

loans.use: The majority of the women involved in the committee have invested their loans to buy goods for their businesses: linens, thread for sewing and embroidery.  Others buy clothes to sell as traveling saleswomen

loans.name: Munaku C(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Racheal is a single mother of two children. She sells used clothes. She wants to use the extra profits to open her own cloth stall next to her home. Juliet sells charcoal, while Joyce is a food vendor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in cloth business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B. is married with one child. She lives in Ordzhonikidze. Marina sells clothing in the local central market. Marina’s business offers a big assortment of clothing inventory at affordable prices - a combination that is always in high demand with customers. She started her venture three and a half years ago. Today she has about $12000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $700.

Marina is requesting a loan of $1200 to open a new vending facility in a different city market and stock it with merchandise. We believe Marina’s responsibility, focused commitment and willingness to make sacrifices even at her own expense will guarantee prompt loan repayment and result in the success of her small business.

loans.use: To open seasonal clothing facility

loans.name: Juana Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is from the community of Chiara, which is over an hour outside of Ayacucho. She belongs to the community bank “Iris Lanao,” where she serves as the president. Gabriela is 32 years old. She is married and has two children who are 13 and 14. Gabriela got married when she was only 17 years and initially lived with her in-laws. Now, she and her husband live in their own home where Gabriela operates a store selling food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar. She also sells fruits and vegetables and is thinking about expanding her business to sell meat. Gabriela mentioned that in the beginning she sold very few products, and now, with the help of her community bank, she is able to sell many more items. Gabriela and her husband also have fields where they grow corn, barley, and potatoes for their family’s consumption.

Gabriela needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying a refrigerator so that she can begin to sell meat. The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Right now Gabriela is saving to buy more fields and for her children’s education. Her dream is to have a big business and that her children will receive a good education.

loans.use: Gabriela will invest in buying a refrigerator so that she can begin to sell meat.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio has a minibus which provides inter-city public transport between El Alto and La Paz: he drives and (as do many Bolivian women) his wife works as conductor on the same minibus (her work is to collect money from every person who gets on the minibus and also to indicate the minibus’ route). This provides the income with which they provide for their four small children: they live in the area Villa Ingenio in the town of El Alto.

The loan that Particio is now asking for is in order to buy cement and iron in order to continue improving their small family home, refurbishing it in order to provide their son with a better quality home.

This is their second Kiva loan: their prompt repayment has allowed them to apply for another loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Patricio tiene su minibús que trabaja de transporte publico Inter ciudad El Alto – La Paz; él trabaja de chofer y como muchas mujeres bolivianas la esposa trabaja de ayudante en el mismo minibús (su trabajo es cobrar el costo del pasaje a cada persona que sube al minibús y al mismo tiempo indicar cual es la ruta del minibús). Esta es su fuente de ingreso con lo que mantienen a sus cuatro pequeños hijos; vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita es para comprar cemento y fierro y continuar mejorando su pequeña vivienda familiar, con una refacción de la misma, lo cual le ayudara a tener mejor calidad de hábitat para su hijo.

Es el segundo crédito con kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Refurbishment of house - purchase cement and iron

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Isabel and Julia have belonged to the community bank “Iris Lanao” for six months. They are both from the countryside and travel for over an hour to attend meetings. From participating in the community bank, they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to save.

Isabel is 19 years old. She and her mother run a store selling food staples such as wheat, flour, and sugar. Her mother, grandmother, and aunt are also members of the community bank. Isabel is also studying to be a nurse.

Julia is 33 and has five children. Her primary language is Quechua, but she speaks some Spanish. Julia also sells food staples from her home in the country. She has had her business for three years, and before that worked in the fields.

Isabel and Julia need loans of 600 and 1500 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which they will invest in their businesses by buying products such as flour, milk, beans, and sugar. The community bank emphasizes the importance of savings and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Isabel is saving to pay for nursing school and Julia is saving to buy furniture for her house. They dream of continuing to work hard and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: Isabel and Julia will invest in their businesses by buying products such as flour, milk, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Señor Carlos M. lives in his own house in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria are of La Paz. Carlos is an public administration officer in the department of La Paz.

With previous loans he has undertaken the construction of his home and the installation of running water and waste-disposal systems.

The loan now being requested will be used for the construction of walls in his house. This is the seventh occasion that he has asked for a loan and socioeconomic analysis undertaken leaves him favourably qualified to be able to request a further loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Carlos M. vive en casa propia en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Carlos es rentista de la administración pública del departamento de La Paz.

Con créditos anteriores realizó la construcción de su vivienda y la instalación de agua y alcantarillado.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción del amurallado de su vivienda. Esta es la séptima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Constrcution of a house wall

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Señor Albino A. lives in his own house in the Alpacoma zone of La Paz city, with his wife and his three children. Señor Albino works in a brick factory.

With previous credits Albino has managed to wall around 50% of his home, leaving the south and west walls at foundation level.

This loan will be used to finish the walling of his house. This is the fourth time he has asked for a loan, and socioeconomic analysis undertaken qualifies him favourably to apply for another credit.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Albino A. vive en casa propia en la zona Alpacoma de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos. El señor Albino es empleado en una fábrica de ladrillos.

Con anteriores créditos el señor Albino realizó el amurallado de su vivienda en un 50%, quedando en cimientos los muros Sur y Oeste.

El crédito solicitado será destinado al acabado del amurallado de su vivienda. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Finish building the perimeter wall of his house

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Señora Petrona C. lives in her own house in the zone of Llojeta in the city of La Paz with her husband, Sebastián Valencia and their two children. Señora Petrona runs a local store from her house and her husband works as a driver in a transport company in La Paz.

With previous credits Petrona has managed to fence their house and roughly construct two rooms.

The asked-for loan will be used to finish the construction of one room. This is the eighth time that she has solicited a loan and socioeconomic analysis undertaken has qualified her favourably to apply for another loan. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2002.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Petrona C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Sebastián Valencia y sus dos hijos. La señora Petrona tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio y el esposo trabaja como chofer en una línea de transporte de la ciudad de La Paz.

Con anteriores créditos la señora Petrona realizó el amurallado de su vivienda y la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra gruesa.

El crédito solicitado será destinado al acabado de construcción de una habitación. Esta es la octava ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.

loans.use: Finish in detail the construction of one more room in her house

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Client history: Ramiro has a vehicle which he uses as a taxi. His home is located in the Pampahasi zone in Said sector of La Paz city.

This is the first time that he has asked for a loan from IMPRO. The money requested will be used to maintain and repair his taxi.

His work and experience have allowed him to apply for this credit as he has already worked as a driver for many years and the income generated is sufficient to cover the loan repayments.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Historia del Cliente: Ramiro tiene una movilidad que trabaja como taxi. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi sector Said de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehiculo.

Su trabajo y experiencia le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene muchos años trabajando como chofer y sus ingresos generados son suficientes para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Repair and Maintenance of his taxi
